texts.es: Luz tiene 40 años, vive al lado D. su pareja y sus hijos, los cuales son su principal motivo D. vivir, juntos habitan una acogedora casa que es propia.Se dedica a la atención D. unas cabinas D. Internet, negocio que puso desD. hace algunos años atrás, con mucho esfuerzo, ahora el negocio es la  principal fuente D. ingresos para  su familia. Hace algún tiempo que su hijo mayor la ayuda porque algunas veces requiere salir a realizar las compras para su  hogar y necesariamente debe dejar a alguien D. confianza en la atención.  Afortunadamente las máquinas funcionan bien y ella alberga esperanzas que en el futuro pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. máquinas y así logre ampliar su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos y pueda mejorar la economía familiar, además espera que sus ingresos mejoren en estas fechas naviD.ñas, ya que habrá mayor cantidad D. gente que quiera comunicarse con sus seres queridos.Es el sexto préstamo con  MFP y  ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, es por esta razón  que su compañera con la que saca créditos confía mucho en ella.Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar una computadora nueva  para sus cabinas D. internet y así empezar a ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and lives with her partner and children, who are her main reason to live. Together they inhabit a cozy house that they own. She is dedicated to Internet kiosks, a business that she has started some years ago with much effort. Now, this business is the main source of income for her family. Her older son has been helping her for some time because sometimes she needs to leave to make some shopping for the house and it is imperative that she lives someone who she trusts taking care of the business. Fortunately, the equipment works well and she hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a number of them in order to expand her business, thus obtaining a bigger income and improving her house finances. Besides, she hopes her income to improve with the holidays season, since there will be a higher quantity of people willing to communicate with their loved ones. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she has been very punctual with her payments. For this reason, her partner with whom she takes loans trusts her very much. With the requested money she wants to buy one new computer for her Internet kiosks to start expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new computer for her business

loans.name: Dayse Paola

texts.es:
Dayse Rodríguez de 32 años, tiene una casa de cemento ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Dayse empezó comprando una pequeña lavadora para su familia pero como una y otra vecina le pedía lavar sus ropas decidió comprar otra lavadora y así entre mas le pedían mas lavadoras compraba con esto ella comenzó el alquiler de lavadoras. 

Ahora Dayse tiene 15 lavadoras en las que las alquila a $ 15.00 la hora, una de las mayores complicaciones es el continuo desgaste de las piezas, esta en unión libre con su pareja en la que el le ayuda con los gastos haciendo fletes en su carro, ellos tienen 1 hijo que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar $ 300.00 en piezas de lavadoras, para construir mejor el lugar de las lavadora también quiere comprar materiales de construcción $ 500.00, mano de obra $ 200. En el futuro quiere ampliar más su lavandería y poder construir más su casa.
texts.en:
Dayse Rodríguez, 32 years old, has a cement house located in the perimeter of Guayaquil. Dayse started by buying a small washing mashine for her family, but since some of her neighboors started asking to do their laundry there, she decided to buy another one. Then, the more people asked for the laundry, the more machines she bought and that was how she started to rent washing machines.

Now Dayse has 15 washing machines, which she rents by $15 per hour. One of the biggest challenges is the continuing wearing of the machines' parts. She lives in a common law marriage and her partner helps with the expenses by doing freights with his car. They have one child, who studies in a public school.

With this loan she wants to buy $ 300.00 of washing machines parts and, in order to improve the machines location, she wants to buy construction materials with $500.00, plus $200 for the labor. In the future, she wants to expand her laundry business and her house.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stones, labor

loans.name: Yamileth De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Yamileth de los Angeles P. ha sido cliente de Ceprodel quien le ha ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de su negocio el cual es la venta de ropa  a la que se dedica desde hace 13 años siendo este el negocio que le permite obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia y apoyar al estudio de dos hijos en edad escolar

Ella está comprometida con su familia a mejorar cada vez el negocio y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para utilizarlo en la compra de la ropa tanto para caballeros, damas y niños para continuar ofreciéndola en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the geographic state called Léon, specifically in the Nagarote municipality, Mrs. Yamileth de los Angeles P. has been a Ceprodel client who has helped improved the conditions of her business. She has been selling clothing for 13 years, and this business enables her to obtain income to support her family and her two school-aged children’s education. She has promised to her family to continuously improve her business so she is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to use to buy clothing for men, women and children in order to continue selling it in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuevo Horizonte nace hace poco mas de 7 meses para tener acceso al crédito y demás servicios que ofrecen la fundación. Se unieron varias vecinas que se conocen desde hace vaR. años y a partir de ahí tomaron el habito de reunirse todos los domingos por las tardes, se ayudan bastante y todas juntas están aprendiendo a construir su comité.
En promedio reciben cada una  580952 G, el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Así la familia de la Sra Estelvina quienes se dedican a la venta de plantas ya que tienen la facilidad de vender ya que el padre trabaja como jardinero en varias casa de la ciudad.
Actualmente con el crédito que obtuvieron mediante la Fundación pudieron abrir un pequeño vivero en el patio de la casa, el vivero se provee de plantas de la ciudad de Cabañas que dista unos 50 km de San Lorenzo.
Ojala que con esta mejora podamos mejorar nuestro nivel de vida y que la Fundación siga ayudando así como a nosotros a otras familias carenciadas.

texts.en:
The “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) Committee was formed a little over 7 months ago in order to access loans and other services offered by the foundation. Several neighbors formed the group as they have known each other for a few years and from there they began meeting every Sunday afternoon. They help each other and together they are learning how to build their Committee. On average they each receive 580952 G, which will be invested in buying articles that will be sold in their respective commercial businesses. Estelvina’s family sells plants as they have the ability to sell since the father works as a gardener in various houses in the city. Today with the loan that they received through the Foundation they were able to open a small nursery on the patio of their house. The nursery has plants from Cabañas city which is 50 km from San Lorenzo. Hopefully with this improvement we can improve our standard of living and that the Foundation will continue helping us as well as other deserving families. 1. Herminia C. sells cosmetics. 2. Olga M. sells lottery tickets. 3. Silvia O. sells food. 4. Gloria M. sells general merchandise. 5. Cristina E. sells turnovers. 6. Margarita S. sells jewelry. 7. Carmen R. is a recycler. 8. Norma B. sells items from Argentina. 9. Estela B. sells clothing, candy, and plants. 10. Severa P. sells food. 11. Lourdes B. sells sells items from Argentina. 12. Estelvina E. sells plants. 13. Sandra B. sells clothing. 14. Francisca M. sells food. 15 Florentina C. sells charcoal. 16 esther R. sells clothing. 17. Elvira M. is a seamstress. 18. Casimira M. sells general merchandise. 19. Marta R. sells plants. 20. Teodora V. sells charcoal. 21. Lilian B. sells underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items for each of their businesses, such as plants, garden items, clothing, groceries, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Dagoberto

texts.es:
Edwin de 39 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Edwin hace muchos años atrás se dedicaba a trabajar en un villar donde pasaba mucho tiempo fuera de su casa y no acompañaba ni ayudaba a su madre en el negocio de venta de comida, el decidió ayudar e invertir en mas comida para preparar.

Ahora Edwin trabaja repartiendo comida en conjunto con su mama que le ayuda cocinando la comida, venden platos con papas, fideos, plátanos incluidos los jugos o colas según que pida el cliente, una de sus mayores dificultades son los ladrones en los buses, no esta casado ni tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, verde, carnes, para preparar más platos. En el futuro quiere poner un local ya instalado todo lo necesario para la comida y también mejorar mas la casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Edwin (39) has a house made of concrete that is located in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Many years ago, Edwin worked in a village far from home - he did not keep his mother company, or help her with her food selling business. He has decided to help, buying more food to prepare. Today, Edwin works delivering the food his mother prepares. They sell potatoes, noodles, plantains, fruit juice, and soft drinks in whatever combination the customer wants. The biggest difficulty for Edwin is the threat of being robbed when traveling by bus. He is not married and he does not have children. With this loan, Edwin wants to buy rice, greens, and meats to prepare more dishes. In the future, he would like to have his own permanent spot with all the necessities for food preparation; he'd also like to make improvements to his mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, greens and meats

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth (48) comparte su vida con Mauro (55), viven felices en su casa propia al lado de sus hijas Elizabeth (23) y Janeth (22).Desde hace 12 años se dedica  a la venta de golosinas en su triciclo, el que compró con mucho esfuerzo para poder trabajar con mayor comodidad, le gusta el  trabajo ya que obtiene buenas ganancias y así puede colaborar en la  economía familiar, además la relaja mucho y puede interactuar con muchas  personas. El horario que sale a vender es  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta el mediodía ,luego se da un tiempo para el almuerzo y de ahí vuelve a salir con su triciclo a las 3 de la tarde para permanecer hasta las 8 de la noche; aunque  algunas veces le resulta cansado con el paso de los años ya se ha acostumbrado  al horario, y se siente contenta con el negocio  pero siempre piensa en el futuro de su familia es por eso  que tiene planeado aperturar una tienda estable en el futuro, ya que le sobran las ganas de salir adelante.Es su tercer crédito con MFP, promete ser  puntual y responsable en cada uno de los pagos como siempre.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para surtir su triciclo y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth (48) shares her life with Mauro (55). They live happily in their own home with their daughters Elizabeth (23) and Janeth (22). Twelve years ago, she started selling sweets in her food cart, which she bought with effort in order to make her rounds easier. She loves to work and makes a good profit, which goes to supporting her family. Work also relaxes her and she gets to interact with lots of people. She goes out in her food cart at 8 a.m., comes back for lunch at noon, then goes out again from 3 p.m. to 8 p.m. Although sometimes she finds herself tired after so many years, she has gotten used to the schedule. She does think about her family's well being, however, so she is planning on opening a store in the future, as she has a great willingness to prosper. In this third loan with Kiva partner MFP, Elizabeth promises to be timely and responsible with each of her payments, as always. With the money, she will buy more sweets and candy to stock her cart and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase her sales

loans.name: Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa nace hace poco más de 1 año después que varias señoras que ya se tenían experiencia en trabajo en comité decidieron empezar de nuevo. 
Las mismas son del asentamiento Marquetalia, son bastante estrictas y rigurosas en cuanto al cumplimiento en el comité, gracias a ello han logrado cancelar de manera excelente todos sus créditos.   
En promedio reciben cada una  635,924 gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Este es un asentamiento con familias muy pobres pero que a pesar de todo lograron sobre llevar toda las necesidades que cada familia pasa, mediante el esfuerzo especialmente de las madres que realizan cualquier trabajo para mantener y alimentar a sus hijos.
Así como Ña Mercedes existe mucho en el asentamiento ella es una señora madre soltera de tres hijos quien se dedica al reciclaje y actualmente con el crédito de la Fundación pudo poner un puesto de ventas de empanadas y gracias a eso ya no necesitan sacrificarse tanto y por ello agradece a la fundación.

texts.en:
The group Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa ("Let's work together" in Guarani) was born a year ago after some women who already had experience working in a group, decided to start anew. The women come from the hamlet of Marquetalia, and are strict about following the rules of the group, thanks to which they have been able to pay all of their loans with an excellent record. On average, each member receives Gs. 635,924 (approx. U$D 140) which will buy supplies and products that each member will sell in their respective business. The hamlet's families are very poor, but still they have continued to survive and fulfill the needs that every family has thanks to the effort of the women who will take on any job to support and feed their children. There are many women in this community like Mercedes, who is a single mother of three children. She currently collects materials to recycle, but with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to start a business selling "empanadas" (turnovers) at a street vending stand. Thanks to her stand, she no longer needs to make so many sacrifices and for that, she is thankful to the Fundación. 1) Limpia G. - Snack bar 2) Maria F. - Clothing sales 3) Norma M. - Beverage and food sales 4) Teofila Avalo - Fruit and vegetable sales 5) Beatriz D. - Fruit and vegetable sales 6) Mercedes I. - "Empanada" sales 7) Sixta A. - Beverage sales 8) Expedita B. - Food sales 9) Mirian R. - Children clothing sales 10) Dolores B. - Food sales 11) Norma A. - Food sales 12) Evangelista Z. - Charcoal sales 13) Adelina Cañete - Sweets and candy sales 14) Liz Ocampos - Clothing sales 15) Teodosia C. - Perfume sales 16) Juana V. - Clothing sales 17) Mercedes Z. - Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase their sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia Q. de 49 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Cecilia comenzó con un capital que había reunido comprando poco a poco mercadería y vendiendo a sus vecinos y amigos de su sector, así poco a poco pudo incrementar su mercadería.

Cecilia ahora atiende desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 vendiendo en su tienda, ella vende confites, gaseosas, arroz, lentejas, una de sus mayores complicaciones son los caminos que no están pavimentados, es soltera pero tiene 1 hijo que estudia en un Colegio Fiscal en la que el le ayuda a veces cuando ya no tiene tareas del Colegio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, gaseosas, confites, etc. En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio ampliándolo y surtiendo mas la tienda y así asegura el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Cecilia Q. is 49 years old and owns her own home (made of concrete) in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Cecilia started her business with a bit of money she had saved. She bought products and resold them to her neighbors and friends. Slowly, she was able to increase the variety of her products. Today, Cecilia has her own store and helps customers from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. - she sells sweets, soft drinks, rice, and lentils. One of the obstacles to her business is that roads are not paved. Cecilia is single, but has a son who goes to public school. He helps her sometimes when he does not have homework. With this loan, Cecilia wants to buy beverages, soft drinks, sweets, etc. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her business by making it bigger and stocking the store better. She hopes to ensure the future of her child this way.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, sweets, beverages

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, el señor Walter R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación que mucho requiere de él. Está en el deber de mantener a sus tres hijos y brindarles los estudios y las condiciones necesarias para vivir en su vivienda.

Una dificultad que atraviesa actualmente es que requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque se ha visto afectada y es por esta razón que ha decidido iniciar a reconstruir dicha vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera llegar a cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Mr. Walter R. - with great effort - works hard with the goal of supporting his family and his household. He supports his three children, providing them with an education and what they need at home. Mr. R. is having great difficulty currently - his home is in need of repairs. He has decided he would like to make improvements to his home in order to provide better living conditions for his children. He is requesting this loan to buy the construction materials he needs so that he can have a decent home in which his children will thrive.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge S. gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente con el fin de brindarle excelentes condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y por sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar.

El señor Jorge se ha dedicado con mucho empeño a su trabajo porque anhela que sus hijos lleguen a triunfar en la vida y también porque requiere mejorar las instalaciones de su vivienda. Es por este motivo que el señor S. ha decidido invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción para dar lugar de esta manera a la reconstrucción de dicha vivienda para la satisfacción propia y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
For much of his life, Mr. Jorge S. has worked very hard to create an excellent quality of life for his family which includes his wife and their three school-aged children. Mr. Jorge has been so dedicated to his work because he longs for his children to succeed in life and also because he needs to improve the facilities in his home. It is for this reason that Mr. S. has decided to buy the construction materials in order to reconstruct his home for his own satisfaction and that of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
La señora Jacoba es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desD. hace 9 años, vive en el distrito D. Chucuito, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 62 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria (incompleta), se dedica a la venta D. artesanía.

Jacoba nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su capital propio y mejorar sus ventas. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacoba has been a member of the Santa Barbara II Communal Bank for nine years. She lives in the District of Chucuito, Province and Department of Puno. Jacoba is 62 years old, married, and has two children. She did not complete elementary school and makes her living selling handicrafts.

Jacoba tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy cloth and wool.

Her dream for the future is to build up her own capital and improve her sales. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth & wool

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La señorita Karen es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 meses atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior completa, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Karen nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es viajar al extranjero con sus productos y ejercer su profesión. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Miss Karen has been a partner of “La Juleñita” community bank for the past six months. The bank is in the disrict of Juli, provence of Chucuito in the neighborhood of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and does not have children. She has her high school studies completed and works selling handcrafts. Karen tells us of her first loan requested with the Manuela Ramos Movement that was for S/500 Peruvian nuevos soles. This loan helped her to increase her working capital and to buy more products. She is requesting a loan of S/400 nuevos soles with which she will buy wool and embroidery materials. Her dreams for the future are to travel abroad with her products and practice her profession. What she likes most about her community bank are the savings and their punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buy wool and embroidery material

loans.name: Princesa Rita

texts.es:
La señora Princesa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 9 años, vive en el distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Princesa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lanas al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanías en puno donde pueda vender sus productos y generar mayores ingresos. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, las bromas que se hacen en las reuniones y lo amable que es la promotora.
texts.en:
Princesa has been a member of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank for nine years. She lives in the Chucuito district, Puno province and department. She is a 35 year old single mother and has one child. She attended school until her fifth year of high school. She sells handicrafts. Princesa tells us that she used her first loan for 300 PEN from the Manuela Ramos movement to increase her capital and buy more products. She is asking for a loan for 700 PEN to be able to buy wholesale cloth and wool. Her dream for the future is to have a handicrafts store in Puno where she would be able to sell her products and generate greater earnings. What she really likes about her Communal Bank are the punctuality, the jokes that are made during the meetings, and the kindness of the loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and wool

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César M. G. es un joven de 29 años de edad, el cual vive  con sus padres y sus hermanos, en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a César a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 

César desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera y diferentes utensilios para poder iniciar con su negocio ya que quiere ser un microempresaria exitoso y  así poder ayudar a sacar a su familia adelante, esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero. 

César es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
César M. G. is a 29 year old man who lives with his parents and siblings in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the Cartago province. It is a small, rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. The people of El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba are involved in the production of milk and the growing of coffee. The town is situated in hills and much of the terrain is tropical rainforest. The community has very picturesque scenery that combines tropical forest with two pretty lagoons, coffee plantations and dairy farms. El Sauce is located approximately one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, the closest commercial center. However, several times a year the road become impassible because of the rains that batter the area. This is, without a doubt, one of the main challenges for the community. When there isn’t much else available, many people opt to look for work in Turrialba or on banana farms located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so much that neighbors are looking for ways to invest in projects right in the area and in this way avoid emigrating. As part of the solution to this situation, two years ago a cheese making plant was set up in the community. It is the property of the Association of Milk Producers of El Sauce. This motivated César to start producing milk in order to sell to this plant. César would like to obtain a loan for ¢670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy a dairy cow and other equipment in order to set up his business. He wants to be a successful entrepreneur and be able to help his family get ahead. This is one of the things that motivates him to put forth effort and work very hard. César is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, one of the one hundred organizations belonging to the micro finance association Edesa in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. Thanks to this type of organization and their means for facilitating loans, he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
Ude  Mana el nombre del grupo surge por que la mayoría de las integrantes que creen que dios proveerá  más a los necesitados de la misma manera que dio el pan de vida. Ellos se reúnen  quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Este grupo está ubicado en la colonia infonavit ferrocarrilero de la ciudad de  Tierra Blanca Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes de los cuales solo ocho salen en la foto.  

La representante del grupo se llama Marylu Pérez E. tiene 48 año de edad, tiene  4 hijo de los cuales todos son  varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de topper  y necesita el préstamo para invertir  en su actividad y volver a poner el negocio de venta de elotes y esquites.  El sueño de doña Marylu es poner una verdulería ya que cuenta con un local el cual no lo utiliza por motivo de que no cuenta con el recurso necesario para surtirse.

Los integrantes son: Maria Guadalupe M. R. ella vende ropa, Maria Leticia A. Vásquez ella tiene una estética, Juana Guadalupe Jiménez Jiménez ella vende colcha, Gisela P. P. vende topper, Nelly P. R. ella empezara actividad, Luis Yovany M. G. el vende comida, Ofelia P. C. vende tarjetas telcel, Maria Concepción R. Guzmán ella vende ropa, Marylu Pérez E. ella vende topeer.
texts.en:
Ude Mana is the name the group came up with because most of the members believe that God will provide more to those in need the same way He gave us our daily bread. They meet biweekly to make their payments. This group is located in the Infonavit Ferrocrrrilero neighborhood in the city of Tierra Blanca Veracruz. The group is comprised of ten members, but only eight are in the photo. Marylu Pérez represents the group. She is 48 and has four sons. She sells Tupperware, and she needs the loan to invest in her activity and return to set up her business of selling corn and “esquites”. To see definition,click here. Marylu’s dream is to set up a fruit and vegetable store. She has a place, but she does not use it because she does not have the resources to stock it. The members are: Maria Guadalupe M. R.- Sells Clothes Maria Leticia A. Vásquez – Beauty Salon Juana Guadalupe Jiménez Jiménez – Sells Bedspreads Gisela P. P. – Sells Tupperware Nelly P. R. – Will be starting an activity Luis Yovany M. G. – Sells food Ofelia P. C. – Sells Telcel (Cell phone) Cards Maria Concepción R. Guzmán – Sells Clothes Marylu Pérez E. – Sells Tupperware

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Tupperware and expand their businesses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías y también vende artículos para el hogar.

Rosa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y los temas educativos que imparten las promotoras.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank for six years. She lives in the Chucuito district, Puno province and department. She is a 34 year old single mother, and she has two children. She has an elementary school education. She sells handicrafts, and she also sells items for the home. Rosa tells us that with her first loan for 300 PEN from the Manuela Ramos Movement she increased her capital and bought more products. She is asking for a loan for 500 PEN to buy wholesale material and wool. Her dream for the future is to have her own house and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her Communal Bank are the savings and the educational talks given by the loan officers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and wool

loans.name: Yusmery

texts.es:
La señora Yusmery es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 4 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió superior (incompleta) y se dedica a la venta de artesanías.

Yusmery nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,400.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una bodega bien implementada.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yusmery, 26, has been a member of the “La Juleñita" communal bank for the last 4 years. She lives in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is a single mother of one son. She didn't finish higher education and she's in crafts sales. Yusmery tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy more products. She now is asking for 1400 new soles with which to buy wool and flannel at wholesale. Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked store. What she likes most about her communal bank is the easy payment plans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and flannel at wholesale.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió primaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de comida al paso.  En sus tiempos libres se dedica al bordado.

Aurora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar pollo, maíz y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprar algunos muebles y otros para su comodidad y que su hija sea profesional. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago de los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora has been a partner in “La Juleñita” community bank for the past six years. She lives in the Juli district, in the provence of Chucuito near the neighborhood of Puno. She is 43 years hold, lives with her partner and one child. She completed her high school studies. She works selling prepared meals as a street vendor. In her free time, she does embroidery. Aurora tells us about the first loan she had with the Manuela Ramos Movement which was for S/ 300 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to increase her working capital and buy more products. She is requesting a loan of S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she can buy chicken, corn and oil to make her prepared meals.  Her dream for the future is to buy some furniture to be more comfortable and to help her daughter study to become a professional worker. What she likes most about her community bank is the simplicity of the loan payments and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, corn and oil

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas.

Norma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró más productos (golosinas).

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar caramelos, galletas, yogur, gaseosas.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y así progresar. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y de la promotora en cada reunión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma has been a partner in the community bank of “Santa Bárbara 2” for the last five years. She lives in the Chucuito district, in the province and neighborhood of Puno. She is 33 years old, married and has one child. She has completed some of her high school studies and makes a living buying and selling candies. Norma tells us about her first loan requested with the Manuela Ramos Movement which was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she bought more candy products. She has requested a loan of S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she will buy candies, cookies, yogurt and sodas. Her dreams for the future is to improve her business and with it, get ahead. What she likes best about her community bank is the punctuality of the partners and the promoter at each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies, cookies, yogurts and sodas.

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Dolores M. es cliente de CEPRODEL desde febrero del 2002 donde ha trabajado 6 créditos con nuestra institución. Los que ha utilizado para invertir en su negocio, ayudándole a permanecer en el mercado durante todos estos años de existencia del negocio. También parte de este dinero lo ha invertido en la mejora de su casa. 

En todos estos años ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. Con un buen record crediticio. Ella vende comida tales como: pollo tapado, asado, frito, en caldo, carne desmenuzada, carne asada de res, sopas de res, cerdo asado, frito, y gran variedad de fresco. La comida tiene un precio de C$ 35.00 córdobas, y fresco a C$7.00 Córdobas.

Ella tiene 53 años de edad, viuda y con 2 personas a su cargo, una sobrina y su mamá que es una anciana. Vive en el barrio la Fuente, en la parte central de la capital. Donde tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años.

Ella está agradecida con CEPRODEL y espera seguir trabajando con nuestra institución, ya que le gusta el trato humano que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores M. has been a member of CEPRODEL since February of 2002 and has completed 6 loans through our institution. These she has used to invest in her business, helping her to remain in the market throughout all the years the business has existed. Part of the money was also used to make improvements to her home. In all these years she has proven to be a good borrower with a good credit rating. She sells food such as barbequed, roasted or fried chicken, chicken soup, shredded beef, roasted beef, beef soup, roasted or fried pork and a great variety of soft drinks. The food is priced at 35.00 córdobas and the drinks at 7.00 córdobas. She is 53 years old, widowed with 2 people in her care, a niece and her mother who is an old woman. She lives in the Fuente neighborhood, in the center of the capital. This is where she has had her business for the past 10 years. She is grateful for CEPRODEL and hopes to continue working with this institution where she is treated compassionately.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, eggs, rice, beans, oil and new and used clothing

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Eddy Antonio C. García, tiene la edad de 42 años, Labora como Responsable  de limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene Tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran  en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 9 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio de las verjas de la entrada de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darles mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Eddy Antonio C. García is 42 years old. He is a sanitation worker in the Mercando Oriental in Managua. He has three children, two are school-aged. He is married. He has had several Ceprodel loans over six years. In this time he has had 9 loans to improve his home where he lives, thanks to the financing granted from Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. This loan will be used to invest in buying construction materials which will be used to remodel and change the wrought iron on the entrance to his home where he lives, in order to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buy construction materials

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Freddy Alberto R. López, tiene la edad de 42 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene Tres hijos a su cargo, todos están en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 2 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El que utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Señor Freddy Alberto R. López is 42 years old. He works as a manager of a warehouse in the CECNA Training Center. He is married and has 3 children in his care; they are all school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for two years; in this time he has taken 2 loans. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL he was able to make improvements to the house in which he lives. He is an excellent client. The loan requested will be used in purchasing construction materials such as zinc sheeting and metal structural supports to be used to remodel the roof of the house he inhabits, with the objective of giving it better security and providing a better quality of life for his children and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El Señor Freddy C. Alarcón, tiene la edad de 39 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 5 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Freddy C. Alarcón is 39 years old, married, and has four dependent children, two of whom are in school. He is in charge of a warehouse at the CECNA Training Center. Freddy has worked with CEPRODEL for six years. During this time, he has received five loans for making improvements to the house in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for labor and purchase construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and other items to remodel the roof of his house. This will provide greater security and better living conditions for his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor & materials to remodel the roof of his house

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
El Señor José Adán M. L., tiene la edad de 45 años, Labora como Guarda de Seguridad en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Ladrillos, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Adán M. L. is 45 years old and works as a security guard at the CECNA Training Center. He cares for three children, two of whom are school-aged. He is single and has held loans with CEPRODEL for three years. During this time he has invested three loans in the improvement of the place where he lives, thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL, and he is an excellent customer. The loan requested will cover the cost of labor and raw materials for construction, such as cement, bricks, etc. This will be used for the remodeling of his dwelling with the goal of providing better safety and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  Señorita María Lourdes O. González, tiene la edad de 20 años, Labora como Educadora en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, ella tiene un hijos a su cargo, este se encuentran  en edad escolar, es Soltera, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 1 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señorita María Lourdes O. González is 20 years old, and works as a teacher in the Eastern Market of Managua. She has one school-aged son, she is single, and she has worked with loans with CEPRODEL for a few years. Over this period of time, she has invested one loan in the improvement of the home in which she lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent customer.

The requested loan is to be able to invest in the purchase of construction materials. She will use it for remodeling and changing the roof on the home in which she lives, with the objective to give better security and improved life conditions to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Meyling Jaqueline

texts.es:
La  Señorita Meyling Jaqueline G. E., tiene la edad de 24 años, Labora como maestra y tiene un hijos a su cargo, este se encuentran  en edad escolar, es soltera, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizará para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señorita Meyling Jacqueline Gutiérrez E. is 24 years old, and works as a teacher in the Eastern Market of Managua. She has one school-aged son, she is single, and she has worked with loans with CEPRODEL for a few years. Over this period of time she has invested one loan in the improvement of the home in which she lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, she is an excellent customer. The requested loan is to be able to invest in the purchase of construction materials. It will be used for the remodeling and change in the roof of the home in which she lives, with the objective to give greater security and better living conditions to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años, vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos; Geraldine de 17 y Luis Ángel de 3 años.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías, esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de su pequeño hijo, pues aún requiere de sus cuidados. Pero para esta labor, María requiere de buena vista y destreza en las manos, ya que los collares que ella fabrica son elaborados a base de las diferentes semillas que se producen en la selva y la sierra del Perú; una vez terminados los exportan al país de Bolivia, donde tienen gran demanda. 
María trabaja todos los días después de dejar a su pequeño en su escuela (nido), disponiendo de tiempo para ir a la casa de sus amigas para dejarles materiales, ya que ella ha empleado a varias de ellas dándole una comisión por cada collar que realicen, pues sola no se abastecería. 
En un futuro, le gustaría tener un negocio más estable, como un restaurante pollería (especializado en pollo a la brasa), pero sabe que aun tiene que trabajar mucho para lograrlo.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, siendo siempre una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para realizar los pedidos que tienen pendiente.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old, and lives in her own house with her two children; Geraldine who is 17 and Luis Ángel who is 3 years old. For 3 years, she has been selling handicrafts. This business allows her to devote herself to her little son, as he still requires her care. But for this work, Maria requires good eyesight and skill with her hands, since the necklaces that she makes are made with a base of different seeds that are produced in the jungle and the mountains of Peru. When they are finished, they are exported to Bolivia, where there is high demand.

Maria works every day, after leaving her little one at the school, having time to go to her friend's house in order to leave them materials, since she has employed some of them, giving them a commission for every necklace that they make, otherwise they would not be supplied. In the future, she would like to have a more stable business, like a chicken restaurant (specializing in barbecued chicken), but she knows that she has to work a lot in order to achieve it.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is always a very responsible person and punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting now, she will buy a larger quantity of materials in order to make the orders that are pending.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for necklaces

loans.name: Yader Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Yader Jesús T. Jiménez, tiene la edad de 28 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de ellos se encuentran  en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darles mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Yader Jesús T. Jiménez is 28 years old. He works as the manager of a warehouse in the CECNA Training Center. He has two children under his charge, one of whom is school age. He is married and has worked loans with CEPRODEL for the past three years. During this time, he has invested three loans to improve his house, which were granted by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The loan requested is to invest in the purchase of construction materials. The materials used are to remodel and re-roof his home. The objective is to give his children and his wife a better and more secure home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Vilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates an agricultural business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the basic needs of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Esmerna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina E. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Angelina is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates an agricultural business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to supplement the basic needs of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Mrs. Hol S., 39, is a married woman who is blessed with five teenage kids. They live together in a wooden house located in Siem Reap province, where Hol S. has built a grocery store, in which she sells small grocery items to earn a living. Two of the children are employed and provided their little revenue to meet their family’s financial crisis. Hol S. got married many years ago to Mr. Mao Sor, who is 44 and currently works in construction. Hol S. has been constructing a new house for a year but the building is still not completed due to lack of money. Hol S. has requested a loan to enable her to finish building the new house.

loans.use: To finish building a new house

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam S., 24, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries. She is also a skillful tailor who designs clothes for her new and existing customers. She has operated these businesses since 2006 and is able to earn an income of US $6 per day. Her husband is a farmer. He also buys wood to build houses for re-sale, earning an income of US $8 per day. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan to purchase two cows to help plough the rice field before growing rice. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to have a big store selling groceries. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy two cows to help plough the rice fields

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer S. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Jenifer is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jenifer owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Jenifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Jenifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy food for her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg B. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her four children, one son and three daughters, all attend a local secondary school and her husband is currently employed as a security guard for a private company. Uranchimeg operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of local meat products to her many customers. Uranchimeg went into business in 2007 and has steadily grown her earnings in the past two years. Her business has enabled her to improve her family's quality of life and support all of her children's education. Uranchimeg is a hard-working businesswoman and is know for her good personality. She hopes to continue her success in the future and says, "I must grow my business so that I can provide for my large family." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase meat in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell in her shop

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao E. is a villager in Kraing Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sok Saom, is a pot maker. In this business, he now has a problE. because he can not deliver his pots to his customers, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse who will pull a cart to deliver the pots. Mrs. Mao E. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a horse to deliver goods

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn M. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 27 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Charlyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,750 PHP average a month. In 2008, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional construction materials and to pay the cost of labor for house improvement. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to have a little bit more of a comfortable shelter for her family to live in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials and to pay for labor for house improvement

loans.name: Sambaur

texts.en: Mrs. Sambaur M. lives in Kraing Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nheom Phon, makes pots to sell. In this business, he has a problem because he wants to deliver his pots to his customers, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse who will pull a cart to deliver the pots.  Mrs. Sambaur M. is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four are attending the local school and the youngest one is only one year old and too young to work or study. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a horse to help deliver goods

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. His children, aged six and two, are in kindergarten.  Altangerel operates a tire repair and sales business in his town. He started his business in 2006 after conducting a raw materials trading business for several years. At first he conducted only the tire repair business but after two years of stable business growth, he expanded into tire sales in 2008. In a short amount of time he has gained much experience in his business and has built a strong customer base. His profits have allowed him to buy a new house and a yard for his family. Altangerel is a hard-working man and has a good personality. For the future, he has many plans to expand his business. He hopes to expand his tire selection and says, “I am also planning to have my own auto repair shop in the future. It is important because I must save for my children's future." Altangerel is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tires and tire products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tires and tire products for his business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem M., 24, is a widow and lives with her four children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. To make a living, she grows rice and produces traditional Cambodian cakes. She has operated these businesses since 2007 and is able to earn an income of US $4 per day. One of her children is employed in construction in her town, and is also earning an income of US $4 per day. M. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. To make this possible, M. is asking for a loan of US $700 to buy water buffaloes to help plow her rice field. She used to have buffaloes but was forced to sell them when her husband was seriously ill and finally passed away. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to plant more crops on her farmland. She also wants build a new nice house for her family.

loans.use: buy water buffaloes to help plow her rice field

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 31 years old and lives with his mother and younger siblings in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. He supports his family by operating a motorcycle sales and repair business in his town. He sells a variety of Chinese motorcycles to the public. Due to the rough terrain and lack of roads in the Mongolian countryside, motorcycles are a popular form of transportation. Altangerel started his business in 2007 after helping his mother manage her consumer goods business for two years. He has gained much experience and earned a positive reputation amongst his customers. His earnings have enabled him to buy a house and yard for his family. Altangerel is a very open-minded businessman and is known for his good character. He is focused on the future and says, “I want to continue to improve my business.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase motorcycle parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes A. is from the village of Polo. She is 52 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Mercedes owns and operates a business making and selling nipa hut products to local businesses and community members (a nipa hut is a native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to make nipa hut products and to use as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials  and to use as working capital

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en: Batsukh T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her two children, ages 12 and 18, attend a local secondary school. Batsukh is a livestock herder and operates a meat trading business at a rented stall at the local market in her town. She raises a variety of different animals which supply all of the meat for her business. Her husband assists her in running the business by delivering meats at the market while she tends to the animals in the countryside. Batsukh and her husband started their business in 1999 and have made a consistent living over the years. They enjoy their hard work and are always looking for ways to increase their earnings. In the near future she hopes to begin growing vegetables in order to sell them. She says, “One must work hard in order to have a happy life.” Batsukh is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase cows and sheep in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Bayambasuren J. is 48 years old and living with his wife and two sons in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a “ger” in Uvurkhangai Province in central Mongolia. He operates a coal and firewood trading business in his town. Bayambasuren started his business in 2003 and has built a consistent operation over the years. Today he is well-established in the local business community and has a strong customer base.

Bayambasuren is an open-minded businessman and works hard to achieve his goals. He has many plans to continue his business growth and recently purchased livestock in order to start selling meat in addition to coal and firewood. Bayambasuren is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase wood to sell in his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Mrs. Dany Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of eleven people and is located in Chumrov Village in Takoe Province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Dany P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chev Kil, is a farmer who owns a 0.3-hectare field for cultivating rice. Mrs. Dany P. has four children, one of whom helps her in the current business (silk weaving), while two of the others are attending the local school and the youngest one, at five years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: T. Dulamsuren is 58 years old and lives in Zavkhan Province in western Mongolia. All of her children are now fully grown and live on their own, and her husband recently passed away. She lives in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Dulamsuren has managed a small grocery shop in her town since 2001. She is an accountant by trade and has used her business knowledge to build a consistent operation over the years. Dulamsuren enjoys her work and hopes to continue her success in the future. She says, “I am working hard in order to achieve my dreams.” She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 40 years old, is married and has three school-aged children.

Elena owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Hand

texts.en: Hand is 32 years old and lives with her two children in a house in Bayanhongor Province in Mongolia. Her two children, aged 11 and 14, go to a local secondary school. She operates a billiard hall, food cafe and clothing trading business in a local market in her town. She started her food cafe and billiard hall in 1999. In 2003, she expanded her business and began to operate a clothing trading business as well. With her business earnings, she built a house for her family. She is planning to build a little house in the local market in order to rent it out. She says, “My nearest dream is to finish building a little house in the local market.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase clothing from China.

loans.use: To purchase clothing from China

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en: Wevina C. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Wevina owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month. In 2008, Wevina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Wevina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for her children's education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita B. is from the village of Ampinican, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Marcelita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products such as lumpia (spring rolls) in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over fpur years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Marcelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
