loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario C., pictured here standing near a table displaying crabs, is from the village of Anonang, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 53 years old. Mario is widowed and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Mario owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as crabs in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business.

In 2007, Mario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC, including a loan of 15,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mario is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Mario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung C., 24, is married and lives with one school-aged child and his wife (pictured) in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. To make a living, he works at a private local company. He has been employed there since 2006 and is able to earn an income of US $5 per day. His wife makes a living by selling porridge at a local market, earning an income of US $8 per day. Seoung and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan of US $700 to buy wood and equipment to build a new stand from which his wife can sell porridge. This is his second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT MFI. In the future, he hopes he will be able to open a big store selling rice. He also wants to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and equipment to build new stand for selling porridge

loans.name: Dorjdulam

texts.en: T. is 32 years old and lives with her 16-year-old son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, and she makes a living by operating a clothing business.  She started this business in 2006 after working as a salesperson for several years. At first she sold groceries, then moved on to making traditional Mongolian clothing. She is planning to expand her clothing stall in the future. With her business earnings, she pays for her son's education. She is hardworking and has great passion and energy. She says, “With my earnings I want to buy a ger for my son.”  She is requesting a 620,000 tugrug (~$436 US) loan to buy products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase some household items

loans.name: Darlene Gay

texts.en:
Mrs. Darlene Gay C., 27 years of age, is married and is a resident of 2nd South St., Barangay I, Tangub City. She has two minor dependents now at school age. Her husband is an overseas seaman in the person of Mr. June Nathan C..

Although she is receiving a monthly allotment from her husband, still Darlene is doing some business activities in order to help her husband, especially in meeting their daily needs and as preparation for their children’s education in the future.

With a love of cooking, Darlene opened a little eatery in her home and a food stall in the city food court and has been in the business for almost three years. Now, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month and she is also giving employment to others who were unemployed.

Darlene joined Paglaum MPC a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

With a good credit record and performance, Darlene was able to obtain her 3rd loan of P30,000 to add to the capital of her existing two food operations, especially during this peak season of Christmas because Tangub City is known as the “Christmas Symbol Capital of the Philippines”.

The future income of this loan will be used for her family’s daily needs, to pay her obligations to our Coop and also as savings for future use, especially for her children’s education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her eatery businesses

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en: Debbie B. is from the village of Dullan. She is 42 years old and is single. Debbie owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Debbie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Debbie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn P., 35, is married and lives with her three children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. To make a living, she provides cleaning services to people in town. She has been in this line of work since 2007 and is able to earn an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, and earns an income of US $5 per day. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. To make this possible, she is asking for a loan of US $500 to buy bricks to enlarge their house. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes to be able to send her children to a good school and given them a good education.

loans.use: to buy bricks to enlarge a house

loans.name: Lilia

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe C. lives in the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. She makes a living by buying and selling ocean-caught fish to people who live in her community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S., 47, is married and lives with her three children and husband (pictured) in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Since 2001 her husband has operated his motorbike as a taxi, earning an income of 7 USD per day by providing his services at a local market in town.

Len is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. Because her husband’s old motorbike often breaks down and consumes a lot of gasoline, she would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

Len and her family members would like to improve their standard of living and generate more income. With a new motorbike, Len’s husband will be able to attract more customers and so make more money. In the future, Len hopes she will be able to send the children to a good school and become a motorbike dealer herself.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Fe G., 40 years of age, is married and is a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She had six children, five of whom are now teens and one is a minor dependent. Her husband, Ricky, is a pig buyer and butcher. At the same time he sells the meat to their loyal customers and neighbors with Maria’s help. They engaged in this business nine years ago and now are earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP per month.

To add their income in order to meet the needs of their family, Maria also works as a food handler and eatery helper in one of the food houses in the city. She joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a good member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC, Maria is given the privilege of obtaining 14,000 PHP to add to her capital for buying pigs to butcher and sell. The future income from this loan will be used for their daily needs, for loan repayments and for her children’s education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her pig meat business

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Tumendemberel

texts.en: Tumendemberel is 42 years old and lives with her 14-year-old daughter in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent, and her daughter attends the local secondary school. Tumendemberel sells clothes for a living and imports her products from China. She started her business in 2005, and in 2007 began selling women clothes exclusively. Customers are happy with the quality of her products, and she is hardworking lady with good communications skills. She says, “I want to rent one more stall in order to expand my business.” She is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~$914 US) loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more women's apparel to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jourb

texts.en:
Jourb S., 33, is married and lives with her two school-aged children and husband in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Since 2006 her husband has been in business as a motorbike dealer, earning an income of 7 USD per day. Jourb and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living by generating more income.

Jourb is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. She would like to purchase a used motorbike, then resell it to make a profit.

In the future, Jourb hopes she will be able to open her own store selling used motorbikes. She also wants to build a nice, new house for her family and send her children to good schools. In the picture above, she is preparing lunch for her family.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to resell.

loans.name: Benjie

Earlier this year, Benjie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and business. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to supplement his family's income.

loans.name: Undraa

texts.en: Mayagmarsuren Undraa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, or traditional Mongolian tent. Her three children, two sons and a daughter, all attend a local secondary school. Undraa operates a shoe-making business in her town with help from her husband. They specialize in producing many styles of traditional Monglian shoes and work well together, with her husband responsible for making the shoes and she in charge of selling them. The couple has succeeded in expanding their business over the years and are working hard to improve their products. Their earnings have allowed them to greatly improve their quality of life. Undraa says, “We are working hard to save some money for our children.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 US) loan to buy shoe leather, glue and other materials used to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoe leather, glue and other materials

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy P., 37, is a widow who lives with her two children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. With the help of one of her nieces, she sells groceries from her home in the village. Suy has been in business since 2002 and is able to earn an income of 8 USD per day.

Suy and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living by generating more income. Therefore, Suy is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. She would like to purchase a greater variety of groceries with which to stock her store and so expand her current business.

In the future Suy hopes she will be able to open her own big grocery store. She also wants build a nice, new house for her family and send her two children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna Y. is from the village of Mabini, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Edna is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be the first loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa S. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His oldest son is 20 years old and studies in a college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The other two teenage children both go to local secondary schools. Bataa has a small family retail business in which he and his wife both actively participate. They rent a small stall at the local black market and sell various household products. They have been in this business since 2001 and they bought a large container in 2004 to expand their business and provide safe storage for their products. Bataa says that he works hard with his wife to ensure their family's well-being and good education for their children. So far, the oldest son is pursuing higher education and they would like to see the other two children receive good education and pursue their own dreams.

Bataa has requested a loan to purchase more products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena P., 41 years old, is married and lives at Maloro, Tangub City. She is married to Joel, a former seaman and now her business partner, and they are blessed with one child.

Elena is engaged in a food business and has a little eatery (“carinderia” ) in their place. She started this business six years ago and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 8,000 PHP a month.

Elena joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a good member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC, Elena is given the privilege of obtaining 12,000 PHP as her 4th loan to add to the capital of her carinderia business. Her dream is to make her eatery better known and more progressive. She is also hoping that her child will be successful until college for a better future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her carinderia

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en:
Davaahuu T. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Davaahuu has a small business with his wife. He runs a small shoe repair shop in the town. His shop is located inside the local black market and that is why they are usually busy with customers' orders. In addition to shoe repair, Davaahuu and his wife would like to make traditional warm shoes for cold weather. They see a high demand for cheap, warm shoes and Davaahuu's wife knows how to make such traditional winter shoes. Davaahuu would one day like to have a small family-owned shoe factory in which they could make various traditional shoes.

He has requested a loan to purchase raw materials needed for shoe making.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for shoe making

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Mrs. Elma S., 49 years of age, is married and is a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has nine children of whom three are at school age, one is an infant and five are now adults. Her husband, Alfredo, is a carpenter and at the same time a farmer of coco land (a coconut plantation).

Elma has a sari-sari (variety) store from which she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,500 PHP a month which is so helpful to their family income.

Elma joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a newly recognized member, Elma is given the privilege of obtaining 5,000 PHP to add to the capital of her three-year-old sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to meet her family’s needs and for loan repayments.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Mindanao

loans.name: Ulziibat

texts.en: Ulziibat P. is a 47-year-old single mother of four children, three sons and one daughter, and lives with them in Bayanhongor, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Her only daughter goes to a secondary school. Her oldest son is 25 years old and drives a truck for a local gold-mining company. Her second son is disabled and stays home. Her youngest son is just four years old and stays home to help his disabled brother. Ulziibat has gone into business to earn money to feed her children. She ran small cafeteria with a relative beginning in 1998, renting out a small stall close to the local market and offering various dishes mostly for lunch. However, in 2008, she had to go into business selling coal and wood by the bag. Because the temperature drops as low as -40 Celsius in winter, every family needs coal and wood to heat their home.  She has applied for a loan to buy more coal and wood to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more coal and wood to sell to her customers

Eustaquia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

She has successfully repaid seven previous loan from GDMPC, and is applying for a new loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her famiily's life.

loans.name: Febelyn

Ms. Febelyn D., 25 years of age, is single and is a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has one minor dependent (shown in the photo). At present, she is receiving support from her live-in partner who is a coco land (coconut plantation) laborer and caretaker.

Febelyn joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

Now, Febelyn is given the privilege of obtaining 4,000 PHP as her first loan to start her new business which is a sari-sari (variety) store and dried-fish vending business. Her future plan is to build a stall for her sari-sari store business and to expand the market for her dried-fish vending activity.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. lives the village of Mabini, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells a range of products to people in her community. She has been in business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Mildred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has applied for a loan for 5,000 PHP, her first, to buy materials from which to make products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials & pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Ma. Lucy

texts.en: Ma. Lucy R. is from the village of Poblacion South. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ma. Lucy owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimps in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ma. Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Ma. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her fish-selling business and to cover the cost of cultivating their rice farm. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for her children’s education expenditures. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her fish-selling business and for farm cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his car with which he works

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy musical instruments

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a 46-year-old woman who is married and blessed with eight children. They are living in Dalig, Antipolo City, which is in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is a woman who has big dreams to overcome all challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. She and her husband have worked very hard to raise their big family. Despite the many hardships she encountered, she was able to send all of their eight children to school.

She joined Ahon SA Hirap Inc. (ASHI), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2001. For almost eight years in ASHI, she has shown good performance, so she is being trusted by the institution for further loans.

She runs a variety store with a little carenderia (stall selling foods ready to eat). She started her variety store based on her idea of dealing with customers. Her business is growing because the members of the community in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store instead of going to other places. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos as her eleventh loan from ASHI to pay for items including sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, brown sugar, cigarettes, canned goods, candies, soft drinks, and cooking oil.

She dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store. Her children are her motivation to continue in her business. She dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that they will complete a degree in college. Iluminada now feels very happy about her work and the service of ASHI and Kiva. Now, the couple is enjoying seeing that the loans from ASHI change their lives and give them bigger chances of making their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, brown sugar, cigarettes, canned goods, candies, soft drinks, cooking oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Gangamala Group

texts.en:
Iddi K., age 47, is married and has five children. He has been running a café where he sells juice, water, soda and cigarettes for some months and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $520.

This will be Iddi's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to obtain a loan to increase his capital. Iddi will share this loan with his loan group, Gangamala, which has 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Iddi is seated in the back with glasses.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is a 36-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother of six children who are all of minor age. She lives at Antipolo, in the province of Rizal, in the Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a private employee, but his salary is not enough for their daily needs.


As a woman of dreams, in 2005 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a Microfinance Institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she opened a general store and it really helped them to meet their needs. Now on her sixth loan, she wants to borrow Php 25,000 to pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, charcoal and groceries for her store.


She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her goal to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, liquor, rice, charcoal and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business selling ice cream and ice drop to the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail was born in 1959. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region. He is now settled in the Finnish houses in the Fuzuli region. Rafail has a sheep-breeding business and he has five years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy six sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy six sheep

loans.name: Marygen

texts.en: Marygen L. is from the village of Unidos. She is 38 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Marygen owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 1999, Marygen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marygen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating their house. This loan will be her 13th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros S. is 44 years old. She owns a medium-sized piece of land, which she inherited from her grandparents. She earns a living from this land, on which she grows rice and vegetable crops to sell. Her husband helps her with the planting of the crops. He is also skilled in building wooden houses. Recently, someone has hired him to construct a house, but her husband does not have the tools and materials to provide this service. Ros S. has applied for a loan to buy these necessary articles for her husband's work. She will use the rest of the loan to grow her crops.

Ros S. has four children, two of whom are married while the others are single. One grown daughter works, sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita B. is the struggling mother of four children. Since she has her own family and children to raise, she strives to have her own business and earn her own income to be able to provide for the needs of her family and to bring happiness and harmony into their home.

Norita believes that as a mother and a wife, she should have her own way of earning money and not depend on her husband’s income. During her first venture in a business and all throughout the years of maintaining it since 2005, ASHI has been her great source of financial capital. Despite the struggles she faces both in matters of the business and her family, through credit from ASHI somehow her worries were always eased. Now, she is proposing a loan of Php 30,000 as her seventh loan in ASHI to pay for variety of specialty foods like coconut jam, banana chips, peanut butter, barquillos (wafers), turones (banana fritters), custard pie, pinipig (immature rice), lingua de gata (cat's tongue cookies) and other supplies.

Currently in Norita’s growing business, she would like to request a much larger loan amount to supplement her working capital. Someday she wishes her food retail business will grow large enough to have the capacity to sell wholesale. But in the meantime, the proceeds she makes from her business are saved in preparation for the expense of educating her four children. She hopes that until their graduation from college, she will be able to give her support financially.

loans.use: To buy specialty foods for resale

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin D. was born in 1979. He has 2 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from an Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region, now settled Bala Bahmanli village in the Fuzuli region. Yasin has been in the butchery business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy meat to improve his butchery business.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a forty-five-year-old married man living in Arzi, Southern Lebanon with his wife and four children. Mouhamad has owned a factory that specializes in building stones and plastic tents since 1992. Mouhamad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy important raw materials necessary to improve his business in order to face the competitors surrounding him. Mouhamad is seeking to spread his business wider--as far as he can--because his clients are currently limited to the local villagers and residents of neighboring areas.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en: Ghanem is a twenty-three-year-old single man living in Chehour, Southern Lebanon. Ghanem, like many other people, has been active in doing several jobs to improve his financial situation. Therefore, he has been working since 2003 as a house painter, as a school bus driver, as the owner of a mini-market, and as an employee in an orphans' association since 2008. Ghanem requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay the remaining expenses for his bus driving job, which will help him increase his income during the summer season, when tourism increases. Ghanem’s clients are the local villagers and people from the neighboring villages. He hopes to reach a level where he can prove himself in interior design and can stop doing the other jobs.

loans.use: To pay the remaining expenses for his bus driving job

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a fifty-five-year-old married man living in El Saksakiyeh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and seven children. Hasan owns a cafeteria and a mini-market, and he sells fruits and vegetables. Being a father of seven children leads to several costs such as school fees, clothes, medications and many other important living expenses. Hasan loves his family and works hard to provide them with all they need. Hasan requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for his mini market; especially since it is the only mini-market in the area, it forces him to work hard to keep in stock everything his customers may ask for. Hasan is also planning to buy an espresso machine, which will provide additional income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his mini-market

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 57-year-old, married man living in Maaroub, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and two kids. Hassan sells charcoal for winter and also owns a truck, which he has used to move things from one place to another for people since 2002. Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy used metals, plastics and iron and re-sell them to be recycled. Hassan has been a micro-credit user for five years and believes that this has been a major factor in helping him develop his work. His clients are his neighbors, relatives and those in neighboring villages. Hassan hopes to reach a restful and peaceful old age.

loans.use: To buy used metals, plastics and iron.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida O. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 55 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Florida owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services for passenger in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Florida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Florida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is a twenty-seven-year-old engaged man living in Al Abbasiyeh, Southern Lebanon. Kamal has been a car painter since 2008 with twelve years of experience working with cars. Kamal was fifteen years old when he first started working; he was a child who didn’t enjoy his childhood as it was supposed to be. Kamal requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy important merchandise and raw materials for his business, and is planning to use a small part for his small wedding. Kamal believes that supporting his work will increase his income and help him financially. His clients are passers by, his relatives, his neighbors, and residents of neighboring villages. Kamal hopes to one day own a big garage where he can do car maintenance and repairs at the same time and in the same place.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials for his business

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо Амонова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Зебо по образованию "педагог". По специальности проработала более 4 лет. В данный момент она занимается бизнесом, торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zebo A., 36, lives in Kulyab. She is married and has 3 children. A teacher by training, Zebo has taught for more than 4 years. At present, she sells clothing at a local market. Zebo A. requested this loan to increase the volume of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: F. Fati has an auto repair business. At this moment, you can see in the picture how Fati repairs the inside of this car. He has been in this business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his auto repair business. Fati is 27 years old. He is single. He lives in Fuzuli region.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru: Садафмо Амрокулова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 59 лет. Разведена, имеет 5 детей. Садафмо имеет, среднее образование. Она имеет хлебопекарню, где печет лепешки для продажи. У нее имеются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для закупа сырья.
texts.en:
Sadafmo A., 59, lives in Kulyab. She is divorced mother of 5 children. Sadafmo A. has a high school diploma. Sadafmo A. owns a bakery where she makes pita bread. The bakery has a number of loyal customers. Mrs. A. requested this loan to purchase baking ingredients.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 43 years old and married with a child. Her child is 15 years old. Her husband is an engineer. He also supports the home. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells medicines to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Amévi

texts.en: Mrs. K. runs a general store. She is married to a singer and they have one child. Her business is brand new. She began running it this year in the Grand Marché of Lomé. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. Specifically, she will buy individual size bags of water, tomatoes, sardines, milk, spaghetti and canned sodas. The profits from this loan will help support her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her general store

loans.name: Moutaerou Akansa

texts.fr:
Cet homme est un réparateur de motocyclettes, il dispose de son atelier au bord d’une route non loin d'un hôtel qui s'appelle "AVENIDA", ce qui lui permet de se faire remarquer par les clients dans le besoin ou qui ont des ennuis avec les roues de leurs motos. La machine à air qu’il utilise est en panne ce qui a ralenti un peu son activité. Il sollicite de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine à air.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient financièrement  aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Moutaerou Akansa R. repairs motorcycles. His shop is located along a road, not far from the Avenida Hotal. This location allows him to be noticed by customers who are having problems with their motorcycles. The compressed air machine that he uses is broken and this loss is slowing down his business. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy a new compressed air machine. He is married and the father of 2 children. The profits from his business will enable him to meet his family's expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new compressed air machine

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun K. is a villager in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to pay for the rice farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, is a laborer. Mrs. Oun K. is 46-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, pesticides, and gasoline to pump water to support the rice field.

loans.name: Afi Koudjodé

texts.en: Mrs. A. makes and sells mattresses and pillows that come in a variety of colours and styles. She is married to a tailor and they have three children. This will be her second loan with WAGES, which she will use to purchase twenty-five bags of kapok (silky fibres used inside mattresses and pillows) and thirteen rolls of fabric to resupply her stock of mattresses and pillows. By helping Agoé, her home town, get a better night’s sleep, Mrs. A. will also be supporting her family and business.

loans.use: Materials used to make mattresses and pillows

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey O. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. TO. Phen, is a construction foreman. In this work, he needs more construction supplies to improve his productivity. Thus, Mrs. Srey O. decided to ask for a loan to buy some construction supplies. She will use the rest of money to buy some food to cook for the construction workers. She is 49-years-old and the mother of two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies and food supplies

loans.name: Sarit

texts.en: Mrs. Sarit T. lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 5-hectare field of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Toem Bros, owns a plowing machine which he hired to help with the rice farming. Now Mrs. Sarit T. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and pesticides. She will use the rest of loan to repair the plowing machine. She is 38-years-old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is grocer and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and repair the plow

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.en: Mrs. V. is married with one child. She works selling local beverages and corn. Specifically, she sells sodabi, a Togolese alcoholic beverage similar to whisky. She began her business in the year 2000 in the Agoé region of Lomé, and is asking to take out her first loan with WAGES. This loan will be used to help Mrs. V. meet her customers’ demands. She will purchase 12 bottles of sodabi and 4 bags of corn.

loans.use: Supply of local beverage and corn

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a forty-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Cecilia works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She hawks to sell (sells door-to-door) and also sells from a table top by the road side. Cecilia buys bags of rice from nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is 40 years old. He is married and has 4 children. His eldest child is 10 years old. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes to also support the home. He has a computer centre where he provides computer services to his customers. His customers are mostly residents and friends. He is a LAPO client. (LAPO) Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more stationery. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is forty-five-years-old. She is divorced and has seven children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Emilia works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey with fried fish. She sells by the road side. Emilia buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement, 29, is married and has two children who are both currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the main occupation of the people is fishing. Clement is a trader. He trades in hardwaressuch as electrical goods. He sells it from a store by the road side in the community. Clement procures his goods from Accra, the capital of Ghana. According to him, he has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Sakariaou

texts.en: Mr. A. runs a grocery store in the Bé district of Lomé. He is married to a hotel manager and they have 2 children. This will be his first loan with WAGES, which he will use to restock his shelves for his clientele. He will purchase prepaid cellphone cards, canned sodas, preserves, pastas, and other diverse products. With the profits, Mr. A.’s entire family will benefit.

loans.use: purchase a variety of grocery products

loans.name: Mirtagi

texts.en: Mirtagi lives in the Fuzuli region. He is 29 years-old and married with one child. He has owned an auto-repair business for four years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his auto-repair business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 46 years old. She is married and has four children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Hannah works hard to support her husband in providing for their family. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetables, such as tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs, etc. in the market square. She says that she buys her goods from nearby communities. Hannah has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk, so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mrs. Khoeurn Choem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who all live in Krang Chamraeun village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Khoeurn C. is the village bank president who was selected by the members, and they will each use the loan for different purposes.

She is a silk weaver, and she wants to develop her weaving business by purchasing more raw materials. Her husband, Mr. Pres Yun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice.

Mrs. Khoeurn C. is 46 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza P. is a 41-year-old woman, and is strong and healthy. She is capable of running her own business to earn money, which she uses to support her family. Since 2006 she has been requesting loans through her membership in ASHI, KIVA's field partner in the Philippines. Those loans have made her successful with her business. Throughout her membership, she has shown a very good credit rating (the basis of a loan with ASHI) during weekly center meetings. She enjoys the solidarity of her fellow members in ASHI, as well as the input about managing a small business that she has gained from them. 


With a much larger amount of business capital, in addition to the knowledge she has gained from her fellow small entrepreneurs, and with the help of her 41-year-old husband, who is a policeman and who lives with her, Analiza will be able to maximize the growth of her business. Therefore, at this time during her membership in ASHI, she is requesting a loan based on the needs of her business and her capacity to pay back. Now, on her 5th loan, she is requesting 20,000 PHP. The loan will be used to purchase fresh cucumbers and papayas, other ingredients needed for making her products, and packaging materials and other supplies. 


She dreams of upgrading to a large food processing business in the future and of being able to get a stall in the market for selling her products. She hopes to see others enjoying the benefits of having loans from the ASHI-KIVA partners that will change their lives. She also wants to continue to move her business toward sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fresh cucumbers and papayas, other ingredients, packaging materials and other supplies.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is twenty-eight years old and divorced. He has three children who are all currently in school. He lives with his children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana where the major occupation of the people is fishing.

Michael trades in hardware such as electrical goods. He sells in a store by the roadside in his community. He procures his goods from Accra. Michael has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods in bulk

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is forty-two years old and married. She has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Naomi works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

She is a trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, and so on, from a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Naomi has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Chann Sina Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The picture includes the twelve people who make up this village bank loan. They all live in Pou village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chann Sina U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school.

She is a seller. She is requesting a loan to help establish a small restaurant, and she would use the loan to buy tables, chairs, iron pots, plates, spoons, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, coffee, and other food items. Her husband, Mr. Pheak Sophorn, is a policeman.

loans.use: to establish a small restaurant.

loans.name: Sakirat

texts.en: Sakirat is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband sells clothes to make a living. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more sales and profits. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Unar

texts.en:
Unar is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All four of her children attend a local secondary school. Her husband is a doctor in the provincial hospital and Unar operates a café in her town.

She began her business in 2007 and currently makes 15 different Mongolian meals. Her business became successful as a result of her high quality cooking and good customer service. Because of the growth of her business, she has been able to hire three employees who are also benefiting from the café’s success. She hopes to keep improving her business so that she can keep contributing to the family’s earnings and so that she can provide her children with a quality education.

Unar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase meat for her café.

loans.use: to purchase raw meat

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is fifty-three years old. and she is married. She has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Agnes is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Agnes has been in business for over twenty-one years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is forty-two years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Vida is a trader. She trades in food such as potatoes. She also sells pineapple. She buys her goods from nearby towns and sells to food vendors in her community. She also sells by the roadside. Vida has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S. is the group leader of five people who all live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pak Ngoy, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice.

Mrs. Sokha S. is requesting a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

She is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are employed at the Thai border. Mrs. Deung S. did not come to take the loan, but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: to buy pig food and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle C. is a God-fearing woman with big dreams. She has been a member of the Kiva field partner, ASHI, since 2008. She and her husband, Sunday, have three children. Their eldest is in high school, while the other two children are elementary students. Education of these three incurs a lot of expense for Merle and her husband to deal with. Her husband is a farmer, while Merle has been selling a variety of different small goods in her sari-sari store. Merle wanted to address the needs of her neighborhood in their community, so she started her own business through loans she received from ASHI. She will be expanding further by purchasing more supplies that will bring satisfaction to her regular costumers and accommodate their daily needs.

On her 4th loan with ASHI, she is requesting 20,000 PHP to use for additional capital to improve her business and her income. The proceeds of her business also support the immediate and basic needs of her family.

Merle hopes that her business will become successful someday. Having the opportunity to access loans through ASHI has enabled her to start reaching for her goal. Along with the success of her business, she is dreaming about the graduation of her three children. Her greatest desire is to give her children a brighter tomorrow, and that is the reason she keeps in her mind and heart, that she will not to surrender to poverty.

loans.use: to pay for goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is thirty-six years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Juliana works hard to be able to provide for herself. She is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Juliana has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Altanporshikh

texts.en:
Altan-Orsikh is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His four children all attend a local secondary school while Altan-Orsikh and his wife operate a retail meat business in their town. Tsevelmaa, Altan-Orsikh’s wife, sells the meat, while he prepares it.

He began his business in 2000, and since then the business has grown and Altan-Orsikh has invested in technology in order to make it more efficient and profitable. With his earnings, he purchased an electric meat slicer which eases his work and gives him the ability to prepare his meat for sale faster than many of his competitors. He has also invested in a storage unit where he can keep excess meat so it can be used when meat is scarce in the market.

He would like to further invest in his business by purchasing a car. He says, “Now I use a taxi or other people’s cars in order to deliver the meat to customers, and this can be quite costly, so I would like to have a car in the future in order to keep expanding my business.” Altan-Orsikh is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat for the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Kodjovi Eloge

texts.en: Mr. A. is a single man who repairs and sells refrigerators. This will be his first loan with the Kiva field partner, WAGES, which he will use to purchase ten refrigerators for resale. He purchases his stock from Lomé, but sells his merchandise specifically in the Bé district. This loan will help Mr. A. to further his professional development in this useful profession.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saroem Moul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people and is located in Kampao village in Takeo province. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Saroem M. is the village bank president. She is 39 years old and the mother of six children, five of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. She is a Khmer noodle seller ("Khmer noodle" refers to soup made with thick rice noodles and a variety of other ingredients).

Her husband, Mr. Kong Rithy, is a security guard. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. As a result, Mrs. Saroem M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Catherine works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside and also supplies to other retailers. Catherine buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu is a forty-nine-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

Mamunatu is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells from a tabletop by the roadside. Mamunatu buys bags of rice from nearby towns. She has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four sons in a house in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her youngest son is in high school, and the next older one is in university.

Bayarmaa operates a retail clothing business out of a stall in a local trading center. She began her business in 2005 after working as a salesperson in another person's clothing business. At first, her working capital was 400,000 MNT, but her business grew quickly and steadily so that now her working capital exceeds 5,500,000 MNT.

Because of her business success, she was able to purchase a house for her family to live in as well as send one of her sons to study in Korea. She says, “I plan to continue to grow my business in the future in order to help my children with their finances.”

Bayarmaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a car which will be used to transport her clothing from China and Ulaanbaatar back to her shop.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Mrs. Tou Chuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people, and they all live in Roka Khpos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Tou C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a vegetable middle woman, buying in bulk and reselling.

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Tou C. is 48 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer. The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell fish

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is twenty-eight years old, married, and has one child who is in school. He lives with his wife and child in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana where the major occupation is fishing.

Daniel is a trader. He trades in goods such as cement, paints, and other building materials. He sells in a store by the roadside in the community. Daniel procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell gari and tapioka

loans.name: Ninjbadgar

texts.en:
Ninjbadgar is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Khovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger". Her son is in university and her two daughters go to a local secondary school. Her husband used to work in Korea, and now he works as a repairman for a private company in Mongolia.

Ninjbadgar operates a raw material trading business during the summer and provides taxi service during the winter. She also works as an interior decorator in order to supplement her family’s earnings. Ninjbadgar is very hard-working and only wants to see her children well educated and happy. Because of this, she is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a better secondhand car to use in her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a better second hand car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of pagne (decorative cloth)

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is thirty years-old and married.  She has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a food vendor and prepares and sells ‘banku’ with fried fish. Banku is cooked dough. She sells by the roadside in her community. Hannah buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old, married without children.  She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports the home. She sells medicine to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana, 28 years of age, is married and mothers three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana on the coast.  As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Joana is a trader who runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She buys her goods from Accra. Joana has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Neyaz Mohammad

texts.en:
The man in the picture is Neyaz M., the son of G. M.. He lives in district 8th of Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has six children. As in Afghanistan, it is wintertime and the weather is getting colder. All the people prepare for this season. 

Neyaz M., who lives in a small house having three rooms and a kitchen, wants to repair most of his house. During the rain and snow in winter, he and his family members face lots of problems. So, he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the required construction materials to start the repairs to his house. 

Neyaz M. is glad that these kinds of processes exist in Afghanistan for the support of those who are in need of money. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders so much.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Enh-Amgalan

texts.en: Enh-Amgalan is 23 years-old and lives with his wife and two year-old son in Tuv province of Monglia. He and his family live in a Ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is pregnant and is currently staying home with their son. Enh-Amgalan supports his family by operating a grocery store in his town. He started his business in 2008 with working capital of 1,500,000 tugrugs (~1050 USD) and since then his business has grown and now his working capital exceeds 4,000,000 tugrugs (~2800 USD). Enh-Amgalan was able to purchase a car from his grocery profits and now is also operating a taxi service in his town in order to supplement his family’s income while his wife is at home. He says, “I want to have my own shop in order to expand my business in the future.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase groceries for his business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mrs. Chreb Hing Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people, all living in Krang Chamraeun village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Chreb H. is the village bank president who has been selecting the members and they will all use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chreb H. is a silk weaver.  She wants to expand her weaving and has decided to request a loan to buy more raw materials to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Ek Phun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chreb H. is 39 years-old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of honey to make Tchouck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell travelling bags

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, 38 years of age, is married and mothers two children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana on the coast.  As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Beatrice is a trader who runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She buys her goods from Accra. Beatrice has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cans and saucepans

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a “ger”. Both of his sons attend a local secondary school, his wife is employed as a dress maker, and Ganbaatar operates a leather clothing making business. He began his company in 2008 after working as a specialized dress maker in a private company for several years. While working in this company, he gained many skills that have helped him when he formed his own business. He makes a variety of leather coats and jackets for his customers, each one according to his or her specifications. He hopes to grow his business in the future so that he can hire employees and train them in sewing. He says, “I plan to have a leather clothing factory in the future.” Ganbaatar is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~650 USD) loan in order to purchase leather for his business.

loans.use: Purchase leather for clothing

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is 26 years old and lives with his parents in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. He and his parents live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Dorjsuren operates an electronic appliance repair business both in his town and in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began his business in 2003 after graduating from technical school with a degree in electronics repair. When he first started his business, he worked out of his home; however, he soon earned a good reputation amongst his customers and a steady income that allowed him to move into a store. He has plans for his business in the future, including growing his Ulaanbaatar branch so that he can attract new clients. He says, “I am planning to get married next year, so I need to save some money for that.” Dorjsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase appliance parts for his business.

loans.use: Purchase appliance parts

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Rosemary is a trader. She trades in second-hand bags. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She also sells in a store by the roadside in her community. Rosemary has been in business for over 16 years and desires to give her business a facelift. She wants the loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand bags

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Florence works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She trades in fresh fish, which supplies to food vendors. She buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in her community. Florence also trades in curtains. Florence has been in business for 10 years and wishes to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en: Myagmarjav is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian tent. His three children all attend a local secondary school, while Myagmarjav and his wife operate a clothing retail business in their town. He began his business in 2002 after working in a private company for several years. For his business, he travels to China in order to import the clothes and his wife sells the clothing. Since beginning his business, Myagmarjav has been able to purchase a truck which he uses in the transportation of the clothes. He also uses the truck as a small transportation service in his spare time to increase the family’s income. He hopes to keep growing his business and says, “I work hard in order to save money for my children’s education.” Myagmarjav is requesting a 2,650,000 tugrug (~1850 USD) loan to purchase more clothes from China in order to grow his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes from China

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 6 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers depuis maintenant des années. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, cinq rouleaux de tissus et de merceries, 3 sacs de 50Kg d’oignon, des cartons de spaghettis et des boites de concentrées de tomate à Bamako, 4 cartons de poissons fumé à Mopti, des sacs de céréales à Fana et une grande quantité de bananes à N’Golobouou et Banko. Tous les produits sont revendus au marché de Fana et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 34 500FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djiguisseme are married women averaging 50 years of age and six children each.  With their husband and children, the women live in large traditional families and reside in Fana City, Fana Coura district, Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  The women know one another through ties of community and kinship.  For several years, they have operated in the commerce of a variety of goods.
