These group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of ensuring the continuation of their lucrative businesses and are now on their tenth solidarity loan.  All the preceding loans have been properly repaid.  With this new loan, they intend to buy five rolls of cloth and some sewing supplies, three 50-kg sacks of onions, some boxes of spaghetti and boxes of tomato paste in Bamako, four boxes of smoked fish in Mopti, some sacks of grain in Fana, and a large quantity of bananas in N’Golobouou and Banko. All of these goods are sold at the Fana marketplace and at fairs in the area to customers composed of women and men. The group members each plan on realizing an average profit of 34,5000 francs CFA per month.  The profits are partly reinvested into the businesses and partly for day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth, fish, condiment, fruit, and grain

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 49 years old. She is married and has six children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist area in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana, so the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Diana is a trader. She runs a provision store by the road side in the community and also sells food items. She procures her goods from Accra. Diana has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: Purchase provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of shoes and hair pieces

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 65 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, some of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Hannah is a trader of jewelry. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Hannah has been in business for over 35 years and wants to expand her business. She needs the loan to procure many kinds of jewelry in bulk – earrings, necklaces, etc.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: N. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young sons in a house in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and N. operates a meat retail business in her town. She began her business in 2004, and since then, has earned enough to buy the home where her family currently lives. She is already planning for her children’s education, even though they are very young. She says, “All I want is to be able to afford a good education for my children in order for them to have happy, productive lives.” N. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat, which she will sell this winter when prices rise.

loans.use: Purchase raw meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of gari and tapioca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Fotemogoban sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Tripano, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parentés et exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le prêt précédent a s’est bien dénoué. 
Avec ce deuxième  prêt elles comptent acheter,  40 litres d’huile alimentaire, des sacs d’oignon, 5 sacs de 50Kg de farine de blé, 10 casiers de boissons non alcoolisées BRAMALI, 5 sacs de sucre et une grande quantité d’articles divers. La plupart des produits sont achetés à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et sont revendus soit à la maison soit au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles estiment  pouvoir réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 36 000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoban group is composed of married women who on average are 32 years of age and have two children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the city of Dioïla, Tripano district, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They came to know each other through neighborhood and family connections.

The group sells a diversity of products. These women have decided to work with the Soro Yiriwas microfinance institution to assure the long-term stability of their profitable business activities. This is their second group loan. The previous one was repaid.

With the second loan, the group plans on buying 40 liters of oil, bags of onions, five 50-kg bags of wheat flour, 10 cases of BRAMALI non-alcoholic beverages, 5 bags of sugar and a large quantity of other products. Most of the products are purchased in Bamako (capital city of the Republic of Mali). They are sold either from home or at the Dioïla market to male and female customers. A monthly profit of 36 000 CFA francs per person is expected. The revenues will be used to pay the interest on the loan, provide for the needs of the family and reinvest in the business. This group hopes to diversify their business by incorporating other revenue generating activities such as the breeding of small ruminants.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour, condiments and diverse items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is forty one years old. She is widowed and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in printed fabrics. Rosemary hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over eighteen years and desires to give her business a facelift. Rosemary therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Mr. Seik Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seik K. is the village bank president for a group which consists of thirteen people who are located in the village of Kampao in the province of Takeo.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes.  

Mr. Seik K. is an ice cream seller. Aside from this business, he is also a palm juice collector. He currently needs money to buy equipment to make palm sugar to sell. His wife, Mrs. Kim Oun, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Seik K. is 37 years old and the father of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy equipment to make palm sugar to sell.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two oldest children, 21 and 17, both attend university while the youngest child, 10, attends a local secondary school. 

Narantuya and her husband operate an iron goods making service in their town. She makes stoves, tongs, and other metal goods which are used in both houses and gers. She began her business in 2006, and since then, she has been able to contribute greatly to her family’s finances with her monthly profits of 80,000-150,000 MNT.  She hopes to keep growing her profits so that her children can continue their education. She says, “I want to save some money for my children’s education.”  Narantuya is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase iron and other metals for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and other metals

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 30-year-old married woman with a 3-year-old daughter and a 10-year-old son who attends school.

Florence owns “Flomax Auto Spares”, which sells spare parts and accessories. She has been in the business for two years. Previously, she worked in a salon. Florence wants to use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts.

Through being a member of Faulu, Florence has learned to manage her business more professionally and has improved her customer service skills and her record keeping. She hopes to establish a boutique someday to improve her income enough to purchase a plot on which to build a house. Florence describes herself as committed and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Manizha Khadeja Group

texts.en:
The pictured group is named Manizha Khadeja group. This group is made up of four female members. Bebe Shafeqa, on the left in the photo, is the group leader. She is 51, mother of 7 children. Manizha Khadeja’s husband has a business of painting cars and he covers all responsibilities of the house expenses, so she would like to take a loan for him to buy the essential materials for his business and to progress in the future. 
The second member is Shoqofa, a bead worker. She started doing this business during the Taliban regime, when all women were confined at home and they had no choice to go out to work. Now, she is quite skillful in her business. With the loan she has requested she would like to expand her business more.

Another member of this group is Manizha. She wants to take a loan for the progress of her tailoring business and she would like to purchase a new sewing machine. 

The other member of this group is Khadeja. She would like to take a loan for her brother’s business. He has got a general store. With a loan, he would buy more materials and would like to expand his business.

They all are happy and would like to extend their gratitude to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For purchasing required materials.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is forty-eight years of age. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana and as a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing.

Juliana is a trader and runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Accra. Juliana has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Makotekokoumana Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Makotekokoumana  sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Timpana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le  commerce d’articles divers (gâteaux, friperie, chaussures, parures, des fruits et légumes etc.) 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le premier prêt a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs de farine de blé, 3 sacs de sucre, 4 casiers de boissons sucrées BRAMALI et une grande quantité d’articles divers (chaussures, parures etc.). 
La plupart des produits sont achetés à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et sont revendus sur place à Timpana et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente des céréales.
texts.en:
The members of the Makotekokoumana group are married women with an average age of 31 and each has 2 children. Each lives with her husband and her children in large traditional families in the village of Timpana, a prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro in Mali. They all met through neighbours and through family. Their business is various types of sales (cakes, clothing, shoes, jewelry, fresh fruits and vegetables etc.)

This group of women are members of the microfinance institution called Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their hopes are to strengthen their businesses. They are currently on their second loan, after having successfully repaid their first.

With this loan they will purchase 5 sacks of wheat flour, 3 sacs of sugar, 4 cases of Bramali softdrinks and a large quantity of assorted merchandise (shoes, jewelry etc.)

The majority of the products are purchase in Mamako (capital city of Mali) and they are resold in Timpana in the Dioila market to a varied clientele.

They hope to see an average of 20 000 FCFA in revenues per month which will be paid to pay the interest of the loan, to provide for the needs fo their respective family and to invest in their business.

Their collective wish is to improve their business by exploring other income generating activities, such as the sales of cereal grains.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, wheat flour, and various other merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells sarongs at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs  to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Edna trades in food items such as corn dough, groundnut (peanut) paste, etc., and sells on a table at the market square. Edna buys bags of maize and other goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Rosinah

texts.en:
Rosinah is a 41-year-old woman who has been tailoring and selling charcoal for the past nineteen years. With the KES 20,000 loan she hopes to purchase materials to make dresses and to buy more charcoal for sale.

Rosinah is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She hopes to educate her children and send them to university. She also aims to be a wholesale supplier for school uniforms in the future. Rosinah describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy materials for making dresses and to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sebedon Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sebedon sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 6 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Timpana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles sont issues de la même grande famille M. et exercent le  commerce d’articles tels l’essence, les lubrifiants, le riz, les céréales sèches, les pagnes, les produits de cueillettes, les produits alimentaires etc. 
Ces femmes ont connues  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso grâce à certaines de leurs connaissances de la ville de Dioïla et ont décidé de l’intégrer dans le souci de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de céréales sèches pour en faire du couscous, dix sacs de riz paddy à N’Diombougou qui sera étuvé avant d’être commercialisé, 5O litres d’essence et 10 litres d’huile moteurs à Dioïla. Tous  ces produits sont revendus sur place à Timpana et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000F CFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Sebedon group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with 6 children. They live in large traditional households with their husbands and children and reside in the village of Timpana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They all come from the same extended family of M. and sell items such as petrol, lubricants, rice, dry cereals, pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth), harvest goods, food products, etc. These women came to know about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) thanks to some of their acquaintances in the city of Dioïla, and decided to join with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are on their sixth solidarity (group) loan, and all the previous loans were repaid properly. With this new loan, they intend to buy a large quantity of dry cereals in order to make couscous, ten bags of paddy rice in N'Diombougou that will be steamed before being sold, 50 litres of petrol, and 10 litres of motor oil in Dioïla. All of these products are re-sold on-the-spot in Timpana and at the market in Dioïla to a clientele composed of women and men. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA per person. A portion of the profit will be reinvested in their businesses, and the rest used to pay for the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel, rice, and dry cereals

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Siguitemasson sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Timpana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  4 sacs de 100Kg de riz paddy devant être étuvé avant la vente, 8 sacs de mil qui seront transformés en couscous, une grande quantité de beurre de karité et des habits d’occasion (friperie). La plupart des produits sont achetés dans les environnants et sont revendus sur place à Timpana et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguitemasson group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with 4 children. They live in large traditional households with their husbands and children in the village of Timpana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community relations. They run businesses selling various items. These women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are on their sixth solidarity (group) loan, and all the previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 4 100-kg bags of paddy rice to be steamed before being sold, 8 bags of millet that will be turned into couscous, a large quantity of shea butter, and second-hand clothing. The majority of their products are bought in the neighbouring areas and are re-sold on-the-spot at Timpana and at the market in Dioïla to a clientele composed of women and men. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA per person. A portion of the profits will be reinvested in their businesses, and the remainder used to pay for the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 36 years old, married, and has a child. Her child is 13 years old. She is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials to make a living. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of basic necessity items to resell

loans.name: Nemroz Group

texts.en: This is the Nemroz group, which is comprised of four members who would like to take a loan for the advancement of their businesses, confident that they will repay the loan on time.  Samar G., the group leader, would like to take a loan for her husband’s sewing shop. The second member is Khadeja who wants to take the loan for her brother to buy a bigger cart for the sale of onions and potatoes. The third member is Zarghona, who wants to take the loan for her husband's taxi business. The last member is Sharifa who wants to take the loan for his husband’s fruit cart. They have all requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 23 years old and has been selling secondhand clothing for three years. With the KES 20,000 loan, he will increase his stock of secondhand clothes.

Thanks to Faulu, Fred has learned about saving. He hopes to improve his standard of living through expanding his business. He describes himself as an optimistic and visionary person.

loans.use: To increase his stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
"I am very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help in improving my business."

Amir D. is applying to Kiva for his second loan. As you know from his first loan, he runs a taxi business and this has not changed. However, he changed his car and now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the spare parts for this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a jewelry-making workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy aluminium cookware

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et résident dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Socoura Est, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Ces femmes qui font le commerce d’articles divers et la restauration ont intégré   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire et tous les  précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de céréales sur place pour en faire des galettes, des poissons frais avec les pêcheurs de Dioïla, une à deux tonnes de bananes et papayes dans le village de N’Golobougou et une quantité suffisante de condiments alimentaires  à Bamako. 
Tous ces produits sont revendus sur place au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans l’activité. 
Elles ont pour ambition de payer des lots à usage d’habitation  pour l’avenir de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with 4 children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional households and reside in the city of Dioïla, East Socoura district, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community relations. These women, who are engaged in food preparation and the sale of various items, joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are on their 13th solidarity (group) loan, and all the previous loans were repaid properly. They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of cereals on-the-spot to make flat biscuits, fresh fish from the fishermen in Dioïla, one to two tonnes of bananas and papayas in the village of N'Golobougou, and a sufficient quantity of food condiments in Bamako. All of these products are re-sold on-the-spot, at the market in Dioïla, and at the local market day fairs to a clientele composed of women and men. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA each. The profits will be used to repay the interest on the loan and provide for the family, with the rest being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to pay for housing plots for the future of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, fruit, cereals, and condiments

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny C., 41 years old, is a pig breeder. He has two children, the eldest 14 years old. He started his business in 2004 and is hoping to be able to raise a larger amount of money to support his children's education. Aside from pigs, the family also has a sari-sari (convenience store) business.  Since Johnny joined the CEVI microcredit program last March, he never worries anymore about where to get money to sustain and support his business.

Johnny would like to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Nornalyn

texts.en:
Nornalyn C. is 39 years old. She has a small farm where she grows rice to be able to feed and clothe her family.  She started tilling the farm in 1993 and currently, her farm is doing well. She has a 17-year-old child who also helps her grow her crops.

Nornalyn said she likes the program of Community Economic Ventures Inc. because it offers an interest rate of only 2%. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 to buy farm supplies so as to grow healthy rice.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria P., 41 years old, owns a small farm where she grows rice and raises pigs, which she sells after four months. The income she makes from farming and raising pigs has helped a lot in buying the food, clothing and other basic needs for her family.  Maria would like to buy more piglets so that she may increase her income. With a bigger business, she could buy her family everything they need. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta F., 47 years old, manages a small hectare (2.5 acres) of rice farm in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She was happy the last time she harvested her rice farm, because she was able to have a bountiful yield. Currently, she is busy preparing the soil.

Marieta is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Murotali

texts.en:
S. Murotali is 42 years old. He is married with 6 adorable children. Murotali has always opted to make his life on his land, grow on it, and work hard. That is how he decided to rear cattle and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. Today Murotali wishes to increase the number of his animals; he would like to buy cattle with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his family with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That is why he is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. Extend your solidarity to Murotali so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan C. is 32 years old. He is a rice farmer and wants to increase his income to support his family's growing needs. He has two children. His eldest child is only seven years old. He dreams of having abundant harvests, so that he can meet the needs of his children.

He wishes to take a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies in order to increase his harvest and income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena Q., 31 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm. She has two children. Her eldest is only 11 years old and is studying in elementary grades. She uses the harvest from her farm to feed her family and then sells the rest to rice traders to generate additional income for her family.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old and married and he has two children who are both in school. He sells "jerry cans" (water containers) and has been in the business for one year. Previously, he was employed as a "casual worker" (a day-laborer or non-salaried worker) by a company. His wife is a farmer. He has been able to plan by using Faulu Kenya. 

George plans to buy 20-liter and 17-liter-sized jerry cans with a loan of Kes.15,000. He hopes to have a stable source of income for him to improve his family's standard of living. He describes himself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy more water containers to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C., age 49, is a rice farmer. She tills a small rice field so she can have a bountiful harvest and buy her family food, clothing, and other basic needs. 

“Sometimes I have a good harvest, sometimes I have few, but I continue to grow rice, because we rely on the harvest of our farm,” she said.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L., age 46, manages and tills a small rice farm in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She started by transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes that, with her effort, she will have an abundant harvest so that she will be able to buy her family food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito P., age 27, manages a rice farm. Although he is a young man, he is already mature  to handle a business. He says that farming is their only source of livelihood and now, he needs money for his business to sustain his livelihood. 

Joselito joined the CEVI program and is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 to buy farm supplies to grow his rice.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro Pareja, Jr., age 26, is a young farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. He learned farming from his parents and wanted to expand his business. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. He said that he needs additional capital to sustain his business.

He is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve his harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano Z., age 27, is a rice farmer. 

He said, “We have a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and I am doing my best to make it productive so I can supply the daily needs of my family.” 

Adriano joined the CEVI micro-credit program in November 2009. He likes the program and wants to borrow more loans from CEVI. Now, he is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan for farm supplies to expand his harvest and increase his income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.en:
S. Radjabali is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 13 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets. Radjabali keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, who, along with his wife, help him care for the animals. Radjabali needs a loan of $800 USD to buy more calves to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible.

 

 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn P. is 33 years old. She owns a small rice farm. She tills from early morning until sunset to ensure that she will have a bountiful harvest to provide for her family. She has five children. Her eldest child is 15 years old. She says that she still needs more money for her farm. She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ma. Glenn

texts.en:
Ma. Glen S. is 42 years old. She is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old. She dreams of providing them with a brighter future and education so that they will be able to get better jobs when they are older. Now, she is busy preparing the soil for the next planting. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to expand her harvest and increase her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn H. is 24 years old. She is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She tills a small parcel of land. She uses the proceeds from her farm to buy food and other basic supplies for her family. Juvelyn dreams of buying more farmland so she can pay to educate her two children. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 5000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Glyjean

texts.en:
Glyjean S. is 21 years old. She manages a small rice farm and a piggery. She has a two-year-old child. Her family relies on the income she makes from the pigs and farm. She sells her harvest to rice traders and she sells her pigs to meat traders. The money she makes helps her to buy food, clothing and other basic supplies for her family.

She would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, piglets, and feed.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta H., age 57, is a rice farmer. Her 17-year-old child was not able to go to college because of financial difficulties. Her business is her only chance to pay for higher education for her children. She needs additional capital for her business so she can increase her income.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sulaimon

texts.en:
M. Sulaimon is 39 years old. He is married and is the father of 6 children. Sulaimon lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan. He grows and sells vegetables, such as potatoes, onions and carrots. Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this loan from Kiva to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase the productivity of his farm. This will allow him to earn a better return on his investment. The profits from his business will enable him to pay for household needs. Sulaimon and his family sincerely thank you for you support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca M. is 54 years old and she grows rice. She is proud of her tenure as a farmer. She has four children. Unfortunately, the older ones were not able to go to college because her income is not yet sufficient. She uses her harvest to feed her family, but when they have enough, they sell the excess to supplement the family income. She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy the farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn S., age 32, is a rice farmer. She has three children. Her eldest child is 8 years old and is currently in the elementary grades. She dreams of a very stable business and income to support their needs. She also dreams that, some day, her children will  be able to graduate from college and get better jobs. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R., age 49, owns a small rice farm. She has four children. Her eldest is 22 years old, but was not able to go to college because of financial difficulties. She would like to expand her harvest so that she can supply whatever her family needs.

She needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Phiader

texts.en:
Phiader is a 47 year old married woman who has three children. One of her children is still in school and another one is married with children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been selling vegetables for three years. She also sells new clothes and earns income from farming maize, beans, oranges and mangos. 

With this loan, she wants to add inventory, such as clothing and vegetables. Previously, she was only selling used and new clothes. She hopes to send her children to college and buy a plot of land some day. In the future, she wants to employ others. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To add inventory, such as clothing and vegetables

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.en:
Mahmadali D. is 38 years old. He is married and the father of three children who are all in primary school. He began to work with land at a young age because of lack of financial resource. He grows different kinds of vegetables, which has allowed him to support his family, but with difficulty. Mahmadali is now requesting first loan of 4000 Somoni to enlarge his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow for onions and wheat. This should allow him to satisfy the needs of his customers and improve socio-economic conditions for his family and himself.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.en:
Farming requires a lot of effort, so Zikrillo has dedicated himself to this endeavor since he was young. Now he is seeking a way to support his family, which consists of his wife and 4 children. Zikrillo needs capital to produce vegetables, such as potatoes, so he has asked IMON for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for his farm. In this way, he can continue supporting his humble home and develop his profession economically.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married with one daughter, Abigail, who is six years old and in school. Elizabeth owns a retail shop, called Baraka G. Shop, where she sells sugar, rice, cooking oil and fat as well as general household items. She has been in business for five years, prior to which she was in farming. Elizabeth plans to buy sugar and shoes for sale, as well as sewing materials, such as cloths, and a sewing machine with the loan of KES 20,000. She hopes to buy more stock in the future and expand her business. Her dream is to grow her business from retail to wholesale. Elizabeth describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is single. He was born in 1986. Farid A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region, now settled in Baku city. He has had a parquet sales business for 3 years. At this moment he sells only parquet and now he would like to buy other goods also and that is why he is applying  for this loan of 2000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
A. Habiba is 57 years old. She is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked at the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and two calves.

Now Habiba wants to expand her business and as her children are grown up she thinks that she will be able to looking after more cattle with their help. So she is requesting 4000 Somoni in order to purchase cattle. Habiba expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Abdelftah

texts.en: Abdelftah is 30 years old. He is married and has one child. Abdelftah is a very diligent and hard-working man. He owns a Taxi office where he provides taxi services inside the city of Gaza, in Palestine. The income he earns helps to support his family. Abdelftah needs more capital to buy a new taxi for the office. He says thank you!

loans.use: To buy a new taxi

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is 40 years old and married with children. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. Ola has a photography studio where she does all photographic works, including taking of pictures and video coverage for events and occasions. She has been a member of LAPO for two years now. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more camera film, photo papers, and a more sophisticated camera to improve her photography business.

loans.use: To purchase more film, photo papers, and a more sophisticated camera.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married and has four children. He has received senior high education.  Daniel sells soft drinks and fresh fish at Bantuma near Elmina in Cape Coast, which he has been doing since 2002. His wife is a hairdresser.  Daniel uses his income to help his wife in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Daniel will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks and fresh fish for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Daniel plans to save to complete his building.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks and fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
J. Sobirjon is 36 years old. He is married with three adorable children. Sobirjon has always opted to make his life on his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to raise cattle and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.

Today Sobirjon wishes to increase the number of his animals and for this reason, he would like to buy calves with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1000 USD. Extend your solidarity to Sobirjon so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand his businesss

loans.name: Murodali

texts.en:
K. Murodali is 51 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Murodali has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering. But he went over to agro-business because the salary was small. And with that small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. 

Murodali works hard to cultivate his produce and also to raise cattle. He works from early morning till late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Murodali sells his crops at the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural produce even more and expand his cattle breeding business. Today Murodali is requesting a loan of 4500 Somoni to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer. Let's help Murodali as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Siliper

texts.en: Siliper is 53 years old and married. She sells vegetables in Mathare in Nairobi. She has been running the business for five years. Siliper really appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her develop her record keeping skills. She intends to add more vegetables to her stock using the loan of  10,000 Kenyan shillings. She hopes to have her own business premises and improve her standard of living. Her dream is to expand into a wholesale business in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and optimistic.

loans.use: To add more vegetables to her stock of produce

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence Y. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education.  Florence is an agent for the leading producer of ice cream in the country, Fan Milk. She sells a variety of ice cream products like Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt at Damanboh near Elmina in Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 2008. Her husband is a trader. Florence uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Florence will use the loan to buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu is a trader. He sells foodstuffs: rice, beans, groundnut oil, and other items. He purchases his goods from Idumota market. He has been running this business for over eight years now, and he has been with LAPO for two years. Abibatu is a 44-year-old father of three children. He hopes to increase his capital in the future and improve his family's standard of living. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He believes that having an assortment of foodstuffs will increase his sales and increase his capital.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bolade

texts.en: F. is the owner of “Glory Bim Salon”; she is a hair stylist, and she sells wares. She has been in the business for a long time. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her businesses. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is married with one child, and she is 31 years old. She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to expand her business and purchase more hair accessories, hair extensions, and wares to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, hair  accessories, and wares to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 41 years old, is married, and has two children who are both in school. He has a business named Tennessee Business Division in Nairobi, which he has been running for one year. He sells food additives such as food colors, food flavorings, and general food merchandise. His wife runs a tree nursery business. Fredrick wants to buy more materials for manufacturing his food products using the loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings. He hopes to have a stable business and plans to improve his standard of living by saving. He wants to move his business to the manufacturing level. He is a marketer by profession.

loans.use: To buy more materials for manufacturing his food products

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Kyrey se encuentra en su 8vo ciclo, tienen un ahorro de Gs. 3.724.000, son señoras que viven en la zona de San  Luis Capiatá, trabajan hace mas  de dos años con la Fundación paraguaya. 
Para ellas este crédito es de gran ayuda pues gracias al dinero al que acceden pueden hacer crecer sus negocios y mantener de una manera digna a sus familias.
Cada una tiene una actividad independiente pero de una o otra manera todas se ayudad comprendo o vendiendo los productos que ofrecen.
Una historia muy especial y conmovedora es de la Sra. Diana Alarcón quien vende remedios naturales, esta es una profesión muy común de las madres en nuestro medio. La Sra. Diana acude muy temprano al mercado para comprar en cantidad sus productos y luego recorre en las despensas de los Barrios de San Lorenzo para vender sus productos, ella ya tiene una clientela formada y su gran parte de su producto con venta segura. Agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda Brindada.

texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey committee is in its 8th cycle, and they have savings of Gs. 3,724. They are women who live in the area of San Luis Capiatá, and they have been working with the Fundacían Paraguaya.

This loan is of great help to them because, thanks to the money they can access, they can grow their businesses and support their families with dignity.

Each woman has an independent business, but, one way or another, each helps by understanding or selling the products that they offer. One very special and moving story is about Diana, who sells natural remedies. This is a very common profession for women in our midst. Diana goes very early to the market to buy her goods in bulk and later travels to the small stores of the neighborhood San Lorenzo to sell her products, she already has regular customers and guaranteed sales for the great part of her products. She is grateful to the Fundacíon for the help offered to her.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 58 años esta casada con el Sr. Juan B., tienen 2 hijas que están estudiando en la Universidad, vive en la ciudad D. San Lorenzo  en su casa propia.
La Sra. Maria tiene una despensa en su casa propia hace 25 años, es un negocio familiar ya que trabajan todos los integrantes D. la familia, mediante sus esfuerzos lograron terminar D. construir una vivienda muy linda y poder pagar los gastos D. la universidad D. sus hijas.
Este crédito es para la compra D. mayor cantidad D. mercaderías a menor costo ya que se acerca las fiestas D. fin D. año.
Es una familia que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and married to Mr. Juan B.. They have two daughters who are studying at university. They live in the city of San Lorenzo in their own home. Maria has had a store in her home for 25 years. It is a family business, and all of the family members work there. Through their efforts, they were able to complete construction on a lovely home and to pay college tuition for their daughters. This loan is for the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise at a lower price, as the year-end festivities are near. This family has maD. much progress in life and give thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for all the support they have provided.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk beverages (soft drinks, wines), foods (breads, noodles, cheese, sugar), cleaning products (soap, bleach), etc.

loans.name: Leonor Julieta

texts.es:
La señorita Leonor vive en la Provincia de Misque a unas 4 horas de Cochabamba. La señorita Leonor es la segunda hija de su familia, ella trabaja con sus padres y su hermano mayor en la confección de ropa.

Hace poco tiempo que murió su madre, quedándose prácticamente sola, y luchando con una enfermedad de la piel que no la deja descansar. El hermano mayor es casado y tiene ya su familia, ella sigue soltera y hace un tiempo atrás monto su taller de costura. Entre sus planes a futuro está en aumentar su patrimonio y tener una empresa  grande.

El crédito le ayudara a comprar más tela para la confección de ropa y así producir más prendas de vestir, tal como era el sueño de su mama. En especial en esta época cuando la venta de sus prendas de vestir sube considerablemente.
texts.en:
Leonor lives in the province of Misque, some 4 hours from Cochabamba. She is the second daughter in her family; she works with her parents and her older brother in the production of clothing. It's been a short time since the death of her mother, leaving her virtually alone, and struggling with a skin disease that does not let her rest. The older brother is married and has his family; she is still single and a short time ago set up her clothing workshop. Among her future plans are to increase her wealth and to have a large company. This loan will help her to buy more fabric for the production of clothing and thus produce more garments, as was the dream of her mother, especially at this time of year when the sale of garments increases considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric for the production of garments

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is 44 years old and married with two children. She sells used clothes of various kinds, different designs of shoes, and bags. She has been in the business for over twelve years and says her business is moving and she looks forward to owning a boutique in the future. Folashade is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her businesses. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more clothes, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, clothes, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón R. esta casado con la señora Silvina Jara  ellos tienen 2 hijos menores  y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Ramón   tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación de junta tapa motor ,el trabaja con su padre  de quien aprendió  este oficio. ,el necesita de este crédito para la compra de materia prima porque ya tiene una buena clientela formada y tiene  pedidos en cantidad. El tiene un  ayudante, de esta manera cumple con su compromiso social y humano en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ramon R. is married to Silvina Jara; they have 2 minor children and live in the house of his parents. Ramon has a small business making motor covers and parts; he works with his father from whom he learned this trade. He needs this loan to buy raw materials because he has formed a good customer base and has a large quantity of orders. He has an assistant, and in this way he fulfills his human and social commitment in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase iron and paint

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: H. Adèle est née en 1985 et vit depuis 24 ans environs au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ABOUBAKAR Mohamed, un revendeur, Adèle est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Adèle vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Adèle n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Adèle exerce cette activité depuis neuf ans. Adèle vend également des produits de cheveux (mèches, pommades, défrisants, shampoing, etc.) devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Adèle s’approvisionne. Adèle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. C’est dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Adèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adele H. was born in 1985 and has lived for the past 24 years in the Fregnon neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mohamed Aboubakar a retail salesman. Adele is the mother of a school-aged child. Adele lives with her child and husband. Together, the couple meet the needs of the family. Adele attended primary school and has studied hair dressing. She has practiced this trade for the past 9 years. Adele also sells hair products such as hair pieces, conditioners, fragrants, shampoos etc., from her home. Adele buys her supplies from Dantokpa the international market in Benin. She has benefited from 2 previous loans with ALIDe, loans that she has duly repaid. Adele is requesting this third loan to increase her stock and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of hair pieces and hair products

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese is married with four children. She is 34 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Dula

texts.es:
La Señora María F. de 33 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos ella vive en la Maica central una zona de la ciudad de Cochabamba, se dedica a la producción de leche y al mismo tiempo a la cría de cerdos la señora María es muy dedicada a su trabajo.
La Señora María se dedica a la educación de sus hijos puesto que cuando se divorcio quedo que el esposo le pasaría pensiones para la educación de los niños pero hasta el momento no la apoya. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano para la entrega de la leche para que no les falte nada a sus hijos que están en la escuela y darles lo mejor que ella pueda brindarles, La señora María se caso muy joven por que se embarazo y sus padres la obligaron a casarse y ella tuvo que vivir con la suegra por mucho tiempo y ayudar en la casa con la producción de leche que hacia la suegra,  María cuenta que estando embarazada de su hijo mayor tenía que realizar trabajos duros de campo como sembrar maíz y en ordeñar a las vacas dos veces al día pero ella no se arrepiente de haber colaborado con la suegra puesto que aprendió mucho con todo lo que vivió.
La señora María solicita el crédito para la compra de un vehiculo de carga o como se lo conoce Motocultor, esto le facilitara el traslado de alfa, soya, chala de un lugar a otro y de esta manera no tener que exigirse tanto fisicamente. Ella sueña con un mejor futuro para sus hijos y les pide que jamás cometan el error que cometió de casarse jóvenes sin antes haber acabado sus estudios y sin tener una profesión
texts.en:
Maria F. is 33 years old, divorced, and has three children. She lives in the Maica central area of the city of Cochabamba. She has a business producing milk and at the same time she raises pigs. Maria is very dedicated to her work. Maria is devoted to the education of her children because when she divorced, her husband was supposed to pay support for the education of the children but so far there has been no support. She works from early in the morning delivering milk so that her children lack for nothing. The children are in school and she provides for them as best she can. Maria got married very young because she was pregnant and her parents compelled her to marry. She had to live with her mother-in-law for some time, and help around the house with the production of milk that her mother-in-law was making. Maria tells us that when she was pregnant with her older child she had to carry out very hard work in the country such as planting corn and milking cows two times a day, but she does not regret working with her mother-in-law because she learned a lot about farm life. Maria is requesting a loan to buy a rototiller with a trailer, or as it is commonly known, a Motocultor. This would facilitate the movement of alfalfa, soybeans and corn husks and cobs from one place to another so she would not have to exert herself so much physically. She dreams of a better future for her children, and she asks that they never make the mistake that she made of marrying young without first having completed her studies and without having a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a rototiller with trailer (MOTOCULTOR)

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: F. Catherine est née en 1979. Mariée à AÏKPE Hyppolite, Catherine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 5 ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Catherine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis près de 20 ans, Catherine vend de l’huile d’arachide et des condiments à son domicile, et aussi de façon ambulante. Catherine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé. Catherine a bien remboursé les crédits qu'elle avait reçu de ALIDé. En ces périodes, Catherine manque de moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Catherine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Catherine F. was born in 1979. She is married to Hyppolite Aikpe and is the mother of 6 school-aged children. The family has lived for the past 5 years in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Together, the couple works to insure the needs of the family. Catherine has not attended school. For nearly 20 years, Catherine has sold peanut oil and food condiments from both her house and door to door. She buys her supplies in Dantikpa, the international market in Benin. As a former client of ALIDe, she has already made and duly repaid 3 loans. Catherine is missing the working capital to meet the present demands of her clientele. For this reason she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five  50 liter containers of peanut oil.

loans.name: Fashoro

texts.en: Fashoro is a devoted member of LAPO. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a transporter. She sells automobile engine oil. She has been running this business for the past five years now. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to buy oil in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase automobile engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man, 24 years of age, married, and the father of one child. He owns a grocery store. He would like to use this loan to acquire supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so he can meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a business in Gaza City in Palestine buying and selling electronics, such as televisions and DVDs. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his turnover of goods. In the future, he hopes to open more branches of his business.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is the owner of a grocery store in Gaza, Palestine. He is 33 years old and single. He lives with his parents and helps pay for his three younger siblings' education. Mohammed is well known in the area. But his main handicap remains the lack of working capitA. to supply his store with food items and other goods to satisfy his customers. Having the capitA. would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To supply his shop with grocery items

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 24 years old and unmarried, sells mobile phones and accessories in the city of Ramallah in Palestine. Demand for Khaled's goods is consistently increasing, so he has applied for a loan that he intends to use to buy more phones and accessories for sale.

loans.use: To buy more phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Samera

texts.en:
Samera, age 50, has worked hard throughout her life to get ahead. She owns a store in the market where she sells various kinds of clothing items. She started this business because she wanted to be able to help pay family expenses. The additional income was needed in order to help her husband to provide for their five children.

Samera is asking for a loan to buy new clothes for sale in order to be able to improve her income and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Eukaria

texts.en:
Eukaria, age 37, is a client with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with five children and lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria.

Eukaria runs a grocery store, selling groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she dreams of someday opening a supermarket.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which she plans to utilize to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed began a business in 2008 selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has a shop near the city of Ramallah in Palestine. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories for sale. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his savings and to expand his business.

Mohammed is 25 years old and unmarried, and he works hard to provide for himself and his parents.

loans.use: To increase his stock of mobile phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Oladunni

texts.en: Oladunni, age 44, is the leader of her lending group and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. Oladunni sells basic provisions and goes to market once every two weeks to buy her goods. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N160,000 to increase the scope and quantity of her goods in order to meet customer demands. The expected increase in profit will be used to supplement the income of her husband, who is a journalist, in order to provide for the basic and educational needs of their three children. Oladunni sends her sincere thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Théodora

texts.fr: T. Théodora est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Théodora vit au quartier Donatin à Cotonou, depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à AGBOZOGNIGBE Roger, Théodora est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement deux des enfants vivent avec le couple à Donatin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Théodora a été à l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis près de 10 ans, Théodora mène comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Théodora s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Théodora est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits à ALIDé. Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés. Théodora sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer ses activités et de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
T. Théodora was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Théodora has been living in the Donatin district in Cotonou, for about 10 years. Married to AGBOZOGNIGBE Roger, Théodora is the mother of 5 children, all attending school. However, only two of the children live with the couple in Donatin. Théodora and her husband both work to support the family.

Théodora studied up to university level, but for about 10 years, she has been selling firewood and and foodstuffs out of her home. She buys her merchandise in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Théodora has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has already received 5 loans from ALIDé. These loans have all been reimbursed in a timely manner. Théodora is requesting a 6th loan from ALIDé, with the goal of bolstering her businesses so that she can better respond to the great demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of truckloads of firewood

loans.name: Mujeres  Anfitrionas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Anfitrionas  nace hace poco más de 2 años, gracias  a la ayuda de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. A la fecha, han superado exitosamente diversas dificultades y han sido solidarias con compañeras que lo necesitaron en su momento.
En promedio reciben cada una  696000 G, el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Todas son mujeres muy luchadoras y se dedican con mucho esfuerzo a cumplir con sus familias en todos los aspectos. Cada una se dedica a una actividad independiente como sigue:

1
Sebastiana B.
Venta de ropas
2
Priscila C.
